description: this Is one of my favorite bars In sf!!..clean friendly place to have some drinks and watch the ufc fights..me and my lady were there last weekend and we watched ufc bellator and boxing all at once..staff Is cool af and I want to especially thank alfonso..bar does not serve food but I love how you can call in uber eats or just bring your own..thanks danny coyles well be back soon!
author: Henry M.

description:
Danny Coyle's is a great spot for catching a game or hanging out with a group of friends. The bar is pretty spacious with ample seating, good drinks, and 3 restrooms. The bartenders are really nice so that's always a  plus. I ordered an Irish coffee and the bartender offered to make a fresh pot of coffee since it was 10pm and they didn't have any coffee at the time. I love the smell of fresh brewed coffee (they use Peet's) so gladly obliged to wait 10 mins for my Irish coffee which was delicious!

Saturday night was a good crowd.. there's a jukebox so different types of music was playing all night. Our group of 10 had a great time hanging out at Danny Coyle's. Definitely a low-key, laid bar to head back to in the near future.

Cash is king but if you prefer plastic then it's minimum of $20 for credit card.
author: Ruby C.

description: A Haight neighborhood bar seemingly off the beaten path with a devoted following of Irish drinkers. It has Carlsbad on draft, something I hadn't seen in a looooong time and a few other drafts like Lagunitas. Again, no real complaints and I understand a bar needs to stock certain libations based on what customers order but it was disappointing that the bar only stocked one kind of rye whiskey. No Templeton or even George Dickel but that's ok too. I'd check it out again if I am ever in the hood, as it IS a nice place with friendly folk. Cheers.
author: Frank L.

description:
I'm normally a fan of divey bars with friendly staff, cheap drinks and good eats. This spot misses a few of those features.

Walking in, it felt like my partner and I were interrupting a conversation that never quite recovered (there were only a couple people in the bar). I enjoy chatting with regulars, but no love that night.

I was also a bit annoyed by how long it took to receive our drinks. The bartender even stopped making them to tell a lengthy story to a person nearby. I was sitting right in front of him the whole time. Come on, fella.

If you're looking for a spot to watch the game, this is the spot for you. Late night dwellers looking for ambiance and mellow conversation, seek additional options.
author: Nicholas G.

description:
Love going to Irish bars. Gavin is a great bar tender, made retry awesome drinks. 

They have a juke box, pay for the songs you wanna hear.
author: Aditya C.

description: One of the better sports bars I've been to in the City. Was not here for a for a very long time due to time constraints but a cool vibe with several tv screens and projector I believe.
author: Rod M.

description:
I recently moved out of San Francisco, but this bar will always hold a place in my heart. Friendly bartenders and awesome owner Brian Coyle. 

It has a great atmosphere, tons of TV's and amazing bartenders. 

Gavin makes amazing drinks and is super attentive even when its crazy busy!

Its hard to have just 1 drink when you go in there, the patrons are super friendly and warm. 

Great place for groups in the back of the bar. 

Thanks for all the great nights. 

xoxo
Farah
author: farah b.

description:
I've been coming to Danny Coyle's for years now. After graduating from UNC in 2010, Danny Coyle's has served as a hub throughout the college basketball season for my friends and I. We often find ourselves here for more than 20 games a year, not even counting the ACC and NCAA tournaments. I wouldn't be anywhere near as close to the Carolina community as I am now without our regular gatherings for games here.

Danny Coyle's is pretty much what you'd expect from an Irish pub. While it's a Carolina bar, it definitely serves a lot of other sports teams, and at times it can get a bit crowded. It's not really my stop-over for everyday drinks, but I have a lot of friends that live in the Haight area that swear by it as a great nightcap spot. Brian is an awesome bartender and always takes great care of his guests (and is EXTREMELY patient with the rowdy Carolina crew).

You'll find plenty of Carolina memorabilia around the bar, but don't let that scare you off. Coyle's is clean, friendly, very comfortable and has good drinks (and great drink specials). And it's also located in the middle of Haight, so it's a great stopover for people passing through the area. I wouldn't say it's a great bar for tourists or visitors, but it's great for locals -- especially if you're a Carolina fan.
author: Matthew L.

description: Danny Coyle's was a cool spot. The atmosphere was fun. The service was fast and friendly and the bartenders were on top of service. They have many TVs so that you will never miss a game. This is a great local spot with a friendly crowd. They have a full bar with beers on tap and bottles.
author: Ron V.

description:
Huge Sportsbar. lots of people inside. Not so many Seahawks during Seahawks game.
However. Bar was very crowdy. I was lucky to get a seat at the bar. 
many screens showing mostly the running events. There was a huge, I mean a huge display in the middle of the bar. Unfortunatly, they placed a Billard-table just infront of the screen. The people have played Billard during the game, which felt weired to me.
However, there were much more games people can play inside the bar. Its very touristic, but its a Sportsbar. Another downside was, that I was not able to connect to the wifi. I think there were too many logged in already.

price ok, but I had no food - just the beer
author: Ben B.

description: I don't leave reviews.  I don't actively use Yelp.  This is the best bar in San Francisco.
author: Mike H.

description:
Who knew there was a Chargers bar in SF... well, not me. We came up to the city to visit some friends who were in town for SD. I told my bf we should get there early bc it would probably be busy...he scoffed and said there aren't "that" many chargers fans in SF...

WRONG

This place was PACKED with Chargers fans, it was unreal. The bartenders were AMAZING, dealing with huge crowds, drunk fans, and just the madness of a packed bar. The prices were typical for a bar in SF. 

If you're a Chargers fan place is for YOU!
author: Channing M.

description:
Great Spot!  Must go to when in SF.  The bartenders are top notch, great atmosphere.  

Best selection of suds.  Great crowd!  Good for watching PL Football also.

Check it Out.  Pull up a seat.

COYS!!
author: Mike M.

description:
Absolutely love this place!

We actually came in due to the fact that we had 30 mins to kill.  Once we were in, I felt as if I was in Ireland, sooo many Irish people and so friendly.

We ended up getting 2 hot toddies (which we never had), pure delicousness, Irish whiskey, lemon, hot water and voila. We also got an Irish whiskey shot and a tecate for $6, how could anyone pass up on that deal?

I highly recommend this place if you're in the area, great people, great vibe and if you're lucky enough you'll get to see the bar tender leave the bar and go smoke with the regulars or just whoever is smoking outside :)

Ps: they stream lots of soccer :), and I also found out that they but boxing ppv at times.  Can't wait to come here and have a proper Irish coffee next time.

Cheers!!!
author: Josh Giosue D.

description: Came here because I typed in "Chargers Bar" ended up watching them on the tiny screen while the Seahawks and Raiders had the big screen. 2017 sucks wish I could put 0 stars
author: Kyle H.

description: Always have so much fun at DC! The bartenders are great- friendly and fun! Glad to live in the neighborhood and see the regulars while catching a game. Gavin in particular is great! I can be a bit picky when it comes to what I'm drinking and he's always ready with a recommendation when I need some guidance or order something new.
author: Jana M.

description:
Wow, lots of 4 and 5 star ratings. 

All I know (knew), being in the area temporarily, was that it looked like a good place to stop by and have a beer, to work on my laptop.  Even the placard outside advertised free wifi and outlets, etc.

Yea, not so much.  I checked the online schedule on their website and saw that no "big" games were being featured on Sunday afternoon; went on yelp and checked the usual popularity on a Sunday afternoon.  All looked good.  I was expecting a reasonably quiet environment when I arrived.

I grabbed a small table across from the bar, there were no outlets, no signs indicating the wifi access.  Apparently there were no servers as I had to go to the bar to order a Stella ($7).  

It wasn't all that busy but the noise level was high; my own internet signal was diminished to the point I couldn't get a good connection, and as stated, there was no signage indicating internet access.  In other words, may be a good bar, but not a place for one to hang out, have a beer and be online...

I left.  Simply wasn't worth it (to me).  From the sounds of the reviews it's a fun place at times, but definitely not fitting my interest...
author: Steve M.

description: I absolutely love this place. Laid back atmosphere yet fun! Bartenders are super friendly. Great Moscow mules!!!
author: Daniella J.

description:
Even though this bar is shared with Chargers fans, during a Seahawks game you feel like you're a Seahawks fan IN Seattle. So much love and great energy!

If you want to get in, you'll need to be here an hour earlier than the game starts at the very minimum. Once they are at capacity it's unlikely you'll get in unless someone decides to leave (and who leaves a Seahawks game early?! ;) ) 

With tons of tv's around, it doesn't matter where you look you'll never miss a moment. There's no food around except slim pickings. Chips, chips, chips. Pass.

My heart is happy watching Seahawks games here!
author: Shereen A.

description:
I'd like to say that I know the history of this place and that I may have even had a hand in some of it, a very small one (Tecate tower... *cough, cough*), but a hand none the less. Ladies and gentlemen, this is a Charger bar. Sure Seahawks fans now also call it home with their recent successes, but years before a #12 jersey ever walked through the front door of Danny Coyle's it was all blue and gold. 

No, it hasn't always been an American football bar and before pigskin ruled supreme the bills were paid by early morning football... the European kind (soccer to us). I've never been here to watch a soccer match but the staff remains the same and will kindly serve you up a stiff cocktail, a sharp shot or if you're a Charger fan, a Tecate of course. 

Food? Nope. Bring your own. They're happy to let you post up with some grub from any of the local haunts and they've even been known to pass you a tray of Oreo cookies if you're sitting empty handed. Nice, nice folks with nothing but love for all... even if you root for a silly team.
author: Brad B.

description: So before I even had the opportunity to see the bounce i was told I was too "fucked up" he may have seen my friend and I singing out loudly and which we do with or without drinking. It was quite embarrassing as people behind us laughed and starred when we knew we were far from drunk (it was 7:30pm) but we were unable to enter and that's why they are receiving a 1. I'm sure the establishment is great but I was unable to fully judge since I was denied entrance at 7:30pm.
author: Alex M.

description: While wandering through the Haight, like a typical tourist, we happened upon Danny Coyle's and their sign for Irish Coffees. We popped in for one, which was delicious and hit the spot, and followed it up with a perfectly pulled Guinness. If you're a soccer fan, especially a Tottenham Hotspurs fan, this is the place for you.
author: Tiffany T.

description:
Extremely rude bouncer told disabled customer (me) "it's not my problem."

I have two broken arms. It was raining hard and I ducked into the doorway so my casts wouldn't get wet. The bouncer (Irish guy with big red beard) told me to wait in line. I'd be happy to oblige except for my arms. I asked if I could stay in the doorway to compose myself, signaled to my two broken arms, and he said "that's not my problem." I kept my cool and said "at least you could be nice about it" to which he responded "f*** off."

Disappointing behavior from a bar that I used to 
go to (but no longer).
author: David P.

description:
1) this place let you bring food in. (I love it!!)
I love Thai food down the street (house of Thai 2) so this is perfect for me to grab some spicy Thai food and go get beer and watch the game. 

2. A lots of HD TV for games. Every kind. Football (soccer), basketball NCB, baseball and hockey. They even have huge projector in the back.  

3. Pet friendly. You can bring your dog here. 

4. Drink are all affordable. Nothing fancy and just great!

5. Easy to find street parking. And they are all residential so no meter.
author: Fah Z.

description: Kinda nicer dive bar, I went here for free stand up on a Tuesday, most of them were pretty funny, its BYOB and we ordered a pizza from a place down the street which worked out great, not a huge beer list, but they had a solid $6 shot of jameo and tecate deal which I did, they had some good local beers though, bartender was nice, and talked to a few of the patrons, overall a good time was had
author: Daniel S.

description: Awesome place to catch a game . They do not have food BUT they do have a pretty sweet delivery set up with "Wing Wings" around the corner . Try the angry Korean wings , they'll deliver them right to you.
author: Brittany A.

description:
Best place to watch the Charger's game in San Fran! My review is more for the food than the bar. Though, the drinks are really reasonably priced and not just for San Fran standards.  

The best part of this bar is that the food truck, fritas tacos, caters at the bar for chargers fans! The owner is a huge chargers fan himself. Best game day California burritos and carnitas fries ever! Can't wait to come back for another game :)
author: Joanna F.

description:
Q: Best trivia in SF?

A: Yes!
author: Ruggy J.

description:
I've came here twice now on Saturday evenings to watch college football after spending the day perusing SF. It's right next to Alamo Square and there's usually street parking within the radius of a few blocks.

They have plenty of TVs with all of the big games on. They also offer specials on certain drinks - $7 for a PB&J (can of PBR and a shot of Jameson). 

Another cool thing about this place is that they allow you to bring your own food into the bar to eat while watching the games. I'll more than likely return again before the season is over.
author: Mackenzie W.

description:
SAN DIEGO SUPER CHARGERS!!!!!

This is the place to go for your Chargers football games!!!  PACKED in this place and everyone was having such a GREAT time!!! Sorry for all the CAPS but I LOVE THIS PLACE!!! Can't wait to go back!! What I wouldn't give to watch a Chargers vs. Oakland game here!!! haha
author: Mike H.

description:
It's a brightly lit, very clean Irish pub.

You read that right.
author: Meg W.

description:
What else do you want from an irish pub besides a good Guinness? Danny Coyle's provides this along with a host of great drink options and perfect bartenders. 

Look no further for your SF Irish drinking pub!
author: Kristen M.

description: Friendly and personable bartenders, great spot! Strong drinks with a smile! :) always has the games on as well as the fights! I enjoy this bar. Cheers!
author: Grant G.

description:
This Irish pub's usually bustling with locals. It's nearly always loud to very loud inside. The flat screens will always have the latest football from around the globe. The bartenders are overworked but they make the most of it, and a little patience is rewarded with good service at the bar.

At first I thought my black & tan was muddled; after asking our bartender, she carefully explained that their beer choice for black & tans is a brown beer so it merely looks as though it's all mixed up. So order your black & tan with confidence!

There weren't any bar fights during our visit, so I can't comment on the entertainment value of this pub. But for our Saturday afternoon visit, it was just fine!

The down & dirty:
Food - ?? - We only had beer.
Service - 4 - It's a dive bar, so "curt but quick" is acceptable!
Value - 4 - Decent prices for SF.
Setting - 4 - It's a sports bar, a little nicer than a dive bar, with generally friendly patrons and TVs.
Date worthy - 3 - You're taking your date to a dive bar??
author: John H.

description: Best bar in SF in the best neighborhood in SF. Real San Francisco without any millennial pretensions. Owned and staffed by really nice people, fun local crowd. If you're into Euro footy this place is Mecca. Vibrant local atmosphere every night and weekend. I'll go out of my way for a pint here, any time of day.
author: Michael A.

description:
Fun outpost in the Haight for the Brainstormer trivia empire!

We showed up at 7:15  for the 8 pm trivia night on Wednesday and were able to score a little side table for four.

Standard Irish pub beers ($5) like Smithwicks and Guinness. And since they serve no food (they do sell some chips), patrons know to bring in Rosamunde sausages and pizza from down the street.
author: Kevin L.

description:
best Chargers bar ever. came here most recently prior to the SDvSF game last month.

shout out to all the loyal Bolts fans. gotta love the camaraderie and good times. was handed at least 2 beers by fellow patrons donning chargers jersies. damn that place must've been a mad house on game day. 

greatest. charger. comeback. ever.

-civilities.
author: Joy M.

description: True neighborhood pub. A great place to catch a game or people watch from a window seat.
author: Leah C.

description:
THIS IS THE BEST CHARGERS BAR EVAAAAR!!! I absolutely love going to this bar on Sundays, Mondays, or Thursdays to cheer on my San Diego Super Chargers.

Alfonso is a wonderful bouncer :)  They have a great deal on a bucket of tecate (6 for $15 I think) The bar tenders are fast, even with all the people crowing the bar to get a drink. Tons of TVs to watch the game on and even a big screen in the back. Lots of places to sit, but on game day you probably will have to stand if you don't get there early enough.  But what i love most is the atmosphere and the experience:

Even long before the game begins the place is filled with Chargers fans.  The tecate towers begin climbing towards and discussions about the upcoming game, players, and what everyone has been up to recently fill the air. 

During the game Chargers fans are going crazy cheering, clapping, chanting, hooting all for the love of their team. When the chargers get a touchdown the team song comes on and EVERYONE sings along (and it is okay if you don't know all of the words because there are plenty of people wearing Danny Coyle's t-shirts that have the lyrics on the back).  I live for the moment when we the Chargers get that TD and I can sing our song along with the rest of the bar!

When the Chargers win there are tons of displays of pure joy by everyone in the bar because WE WON! People high five eachother until their hand goes numb, jump up and down, laugh, hug, and some may even take off their shirt and do a victory dance. It is a place of camraderie and spirit in the name of the Chargers. I love it! 

This place is the place to go if you are a Chargers fan looking for a Chargers bar experience unlike any other.  :)))
author: Apryl S.

description:
Home of The San Diego Chargers Fans in The Bay Area. Hands down one of the funnest places I have ever watched a Chargers game (and I live in San Diego).

Top 3 Places to watch a Charger Game:
1. The Super Bowl
2. Jack Murphy Stadium
3. Danny Coyles.

Grab a bucket of Tecates, and build something in honor of Antoniooooooooooo GATES!

They play the San Diego Super Chargers Theme every time there is a touchdown, and the Charger Fans feel this place is sacred, and show it great respect. Trust me when I say, if you are a Charger Fan, you got to experience it.
author: Hugh K.

description:
Growing up in San Diego and moving to the Bay Area meant I had to find a good place to watch the Chargers and this is the best Chargers bar I have ever been to. The energy here is unrivaled, the beer is cheap, and the bolt pride is plentiful.

Hawks fans like to go there too but Danny Coyles is the best Chargers bar I have ever been to.
author: Michael G.

description: We had a great time at Danny Coyle's for the Seahawks/49ers game last week...until 2 days later when I got a notice from Capital One that their bartender had written himself a $68 tip on our $20 bill.  If this is how someone let's their employees do business do you really want to take your business there?
author: Zack P.

description:
Can't beat the warm welcome they provide for fellow Chargers fans! My friend and I have been using the cheers and chants we learned during every other Chargers game we've seen since stepping foot in Danny Coyles. I proudly wear my DC shirt around SD and can't wait to make it back there the next time I'm the city! 

Keep the Bolt pride alive DC! And make those Tecate towers extra tall for me!! Woo
author: Kristina J.

description: Great Seahawks bar that was easy to find for us travelers trying to find a home in the "enemy" territory that is San Francisco. Small, cozy barn that had some drink specials and also food to order it seemed. Not bad for just stopping by. Not sure how it holds up to other local bars but it's not too bad on my scale.
author: Pauline T.

description:
First let me say that I love coming here for Seahawks games and the three stars is not a reflection if the bar just the people attending. As a native if Seattle when I first moved here I found it hard to find a good place with hawks fans to cheer with me on Sundays. Then I found Danny's this place has always been good to me every time I've been there. 

That being said I was shocked to hear about the experience my friend had. Her and her friend who are also Seahawks fans, went for this years opening game and had a horrible experience. They arrived early to get a table. After sitting for a bit a group of regulars 
(Who will remain nameless) came to their table informing them that, that is their regular table and they needed to move. This continued and escalated. They then said "we will get all our friends to stand in front of you and you won't be able to see the game or get drinks if you don't leave our table." 

I am truly ashamed of those people for treating someone that harsh over a table. Needless to say I have found a new bar to watch my games as I no longer wish to be associated with people who lack respect to their fellow man.
author: Shaun K.

description: Came here for the Chargers game, great atmosphere! The service is the reason for the 1 star and I would honestly give them No Stars if I could.  I ordered a Bucket of Beer, again a great deal for game time, and that is when it went down hill.  After paying, a second bartender came over and before I even put my wallet away said, "what, you don't tip?" I'm not getting into the whole tipping vs. non-tipping, and coming from a restaurant family I know how to tip, however due to the unprofessionalism behind the bar I will never be going to this bar again. (FYI I did end up leaving a tip)
author: Renzo V.

description:
I have never seen such a devoted bar to the Seahawks.  This will be my home next season with this Amazing staff from the bouncer/doorman to the owner!

Go Hawks!!!!
author: Phillip H.

description: Best bar for early Bundesliga games in SF. Mainly a Tottenham Spurs bar, but Dortmund, Bayern Munich, Manchester United, and Bournemouth supporters all frequent it. Especially fun and rowdy for big Tottenham or Dortmund/Bayern games.
author: Nestor G.

description: Thank you, Thank you, Thank you... We had a great time at this bar last night. We were looking for a friendly neighborhood bar and this place delivered. Everyone was so friendly and hospitable. Patrons were singing along to the jukebox when we walked in...:-) We knew we had found the right place. The atmosphere was warm and inviting. As soon as we walked in we were greeted by Dan, the bartender. He made the experience that much better. This bar reminded us of our favorite watering hole at home, where everyone knows your name. Thank you again.
author: Shannon G.

description: Had a lot of fun.  The mixed drinks are innovative but you can always have a great beer.  The bartenders are attentive and personable.   This bar is perfect for the sports afficiando no matter what the sport.   Lots of fun.
author: Barbara S.

description: There's not much to this place. Seahawks and Chargers bar! There's quite a bit of line that forms before the game. I got there an hour before the Seahawks game started and was in line until the Chargers game was over and the fans cleared out. Very warm inside, and completely full. Somehow managed to find some stools, but chances of having to stand are very high. You can get drinks here, but no food, though you can pick some up and bring it in. Kinda dirty, no one buses the tables from the previous people for the whole duration of the game. It is what it is though. Roudy/passionate crowd to watch my team in SF!
author: Kathleen C.

description:
We are the best Chargers bar in the world. HANDS DOWN

If you live in the city and watch at home on your pathetic computer, you are missing out.

If you're visiting town and think it's just 6 Charger fans in front of a small tv, YOU ARE WRONG.

Come to the bar, no matter how lazy or hungover you are, and have the time of your life.

SUNDAYS ARE BETTER AT DANNY COYLE'S
author: Harold C.

description: They serve great Irishmen lots of booze who then lay it on pretty thick for the 1-3 women here. Women, be those women.
author: Em L.

description: Such a great place for Chargers fans to call a home away from home. Nothing like hearing the San Diego Chargers theme song play every time a touchdown is scored and having the whole bar sing along in fervor and excitement. Honestly, I have more fun watching the Bolts at Danny Coyle's than I do back in San Diego. Such a great, fun, and lively group of die-hard fans to watch a game with and a true Chargers bar. Thank you, Danny Coyle's, for having us!
author: Brent S.

description:
Easy to get in.  No cover.  Drinks were good.  Music wasn't so loud that I couldn't talk to people.

Also, great location.
author: Max P.

description: well, its a proper bar serving full size pints and maybe the best Guinness in the City... i know i know its a seahawks bar! But its really just a good sports bar, showing everything... good staff... 5 stars
author: Reg B.

description:
It's a Seahawks bar. When I came here two years ago to watch the 2012 season opener we only had one TV in the corner, but look how far we've come. The NFC Championship game was amazing -- this place was banging. Go Hawks!

Opens early Sundays for Premier League matches. A bunch of TVs with good viewing angles. Surprisingly clean. No kitchen but you can bring outside food and coffee no problem.

Can be tough to get a drink during games, so I recommend the Tecante bucket. In addition to a great deal, the bucket of ice will keep them cold for as long as it'll take you to drink them.

Overall, a great place to catch games (especially so if your rooting interests align with the Chargers or Seahawks) or grab a laid-back beer when the games are over.
author: Greg K.

description: I freaking LOVE this place!!!! I'm a San Diego Native and a die hard Chargers fan! This bar is awesome if you're the former or the latter. If you go during the games you're guaranteed to have a fun time. Everyone there's a Chargers so you'll have plenty of San Diegonites to share the highs and lows of your favorite teams season. They have drink specials and a great selection to choose from. If you ever feel home sick go to Danny Coyles, when the Chargers score a TD the bar ERUPTS in SD spirit and makes you forget your still very much in SF!
author: Shahin K.

description:
This is an awesome bar in San Fran for SEAHAWKS and SOUNDERS fans! GO HAWKS! 

Opens early, the bartender was friendly, with an Irish accent. No food, but I think the bartender said you could bring in outside food.
author: Tracy V.

description:
The story begins with my best friend moving from San Diego to San Francisco...

 A week before he leaves, he asks me "Please god, tell me there's a bar in San Fran where I can watch my Chargers play..."

I don't usually answer to the Lord's name but something made me feel it was necessary to acknowledge his prayers. I asked a friend who I knew moved there a few years ago if he knew of a "truly special place" where a man can watch his frustrating, liquor inducing team watch a game" and he answered with 2 letters (not words, letters).

DC's.

After further elaboration, he added me to the facebook group... I promptly added my friend who would be attending and forgot about it until football preseason began... Something curious happened, I began seeing TRUE FANS (I live in San Diego and they are few and far between here) posting playfully vulgar comments and quips about how excited/dreading our season would be. I became active in the group, posting a few vulgar comments of my own and before I knew it... I was driving 10 hours from SD to SF to join 40+ ROARING CHARGERS FANS for the Chargers/Niners game. 

I arrive on the eve of the game to a roar and friendly bouncer. He smiles, lets me in and I'm oddly known by multiple people I have never met. What is next is a blur but I'll try to decipher the memorable aspects...

- The bar is small, but cozy.
- The people are friendly to the point where you wonder if you should put your wallet in your front pocket (It never left my pants, btw).
- A drink is never far away, I was a bartender for 5+ years and this crew is ON.THEIR.GAME.
- Charger fever is alive here.

I heard laughable scoffs that this place was a seahawks bar. In all honestly... good for them. It's a lot like seeing a girl who suddenly got cute but is still absolutely clueless and terrible to talk to. If you meet one "12th man" in here that actually knows who Jim Mora is, I will legitimately die of shock.

Hands down, best Chargers bar I've ever been to and has some of the greatest human beings here that I've ever had the pleasure of meeting. 

ANTONIOOOOOOOOOOOOOO.

GATES.
author: Jerry M.

description: Great bar to be at whether for sports events or just chilling for a quiet drink. The bartenders and staff are very friendly and welcoming. Danny Coyle's is a Great bar in the city to go to.
author: Allan P.

description:
titles this bar has won: 

-undisputed world's greatest chargers bar on the planet 

-best place to watch a chargers game in san francisco 

-number one chargers theme song rendition -the dc super singers-

-ultimate dream destination to witness a chargers victory 

-sounds the  charge more then any location annually 

if you are bolted in any direction other then up, stay at home.
author: Parker R.

description:
As an Irish lass, I love cozying up inside SF's wide selection of pubs. Danny Coyle's is one of my favorite places to duck into for a weeknight drink, say around 8pm on a Tuesday when you and a pal are craving some whiskey. 

People go there to have a fun time--last time I was there, I found a girl's credit card on the floor, returned it to her, and we celebrated with a round of Fireball shots. It's a friendly, down-home place like that. The bartenders are super nice too. I'm always down for a round at Danny Coyle's.
author: Meredith C.

description: So apparently this is both a charger bar and a seahawks bar. Fortunately, the day I came the two were not playing at the same time, so the review might be different having to deal with a mixed crowd. As it was, I got to watch the chargers play with 100 or so other charger fans and it was a good time. Drinks were cheap. No food, but I guess they let you bring anything in.
author: Ryan E.

description: A must for any Charger fan.   Win or lose it was fun.  Great Bloody Marys and fast bartenders.  Small and crowded like most SAN FRAN bars.   Crazy loud.  Lots of singing.   Lots of TVs and plenty of games.  Everyone wears true Charger gear so get ready for a costume party.
author: Jane W.

description: I'm a huge Seahawks fan and yes, 12s do come here to watch the game, but my Chargers fan friends would be pissed if I called this place a Seahawks bar. Nevertheless, I truly appreciate them for allowing us to watch the games here with them on Sunday! This place is a great place to hang out and drink even on a non-football day so I would check it out if you're ever in the area. $6 PBJ every weekday....I only know since I live near by and pass by on my way home...
author: Cody M.

description:
This is my alumni bar... and it's around the corner from my apartment... so 5 stars was kind of a given. BUT, luckily enough for me, DC's happens to earn it's 5 stars on its own merit.

These are all signs of a great neighborhood bar (In my narrow opinion):

- Good TVs/staff/seating... blah blah blah
- PBR+Jameson shots for $7 (PB&Js!)
- Dogs.
- Credit card valet services*
- Eclectic mix of patrons**
- You can bring in food
- They pour a mean Guinness

_________________________________

*I've left many a credit card behind the bar... once I unknowingly left 2 here on separate occasions which led to an awkward exchange with a bartender that ended with... "Yes, that is mine... I'll take it back... buuut it's not the one I was looking for...heh heh... I'm not an alcoholic."
**Last time we met this woman celebrating her write-up in allure magazine: http://www.yelp.com/biz/lonnis-punani-waxing-san-francisco-3
author: Jake D.

description: It was a very low key pub when I went on a Thursday night, but gets pretty busy once games are on. You can definitely tell that it has the potential to be a really lively bar once the games get going-- so make sure you make your way here to see your favorite sports team play! Lines go out the door!
author: Sophie P.

description: Best Chargers bar ever!! If you find yourself in the bay area looking for a great place to watch your San Diego Chargers this is the best spot. I haven't even been to bars in SD that has the same Chargers atmosphere as this one. A definite must go if you are a Chargers fan in SF
author: AJ L.

description: Drinks are OK, music is OK, food is OK.  Nothing too great or too bad.
author: Derek n.

description:
Went in early to get a seat for UFC last Saturday night. $10 cover, but  it was worth it since I only had one drink for hours and nobody bothered me to order more or give up the extra chair I was saving for my friend. 

In fact, nobody bothered me at all until late in the evening - even then, the guys were drunk and friendly, but not creepy. The bouncers are really nice, too. Good beer selection, HUGE whiskey selection. I'm impressed.
author: Sam Z.

description:
I was in San Francisco for the weekend and wanted to watch the UNC - NCSU game and my girlfriend found out that this is the UNC bar in SF.  The crowd was nice and the bartender was friendly and quick with the drinks.  It was a bit tough to get a good seat (although that's probably because I arrived late for the game).  They allow dogs inside, which is cool.  Also, cheap beer.

A good neighborhood bar.  If I lived in the area, I think this would be my standard watering hole.
author: Jake W.

description: fun place, friendly bartenders. Not sure if they have food, didn't see any, but theres loads of places nearby to eat at.
author: Cliodhna R.

description:
Charger fans living in Bay Area...check this spot out next time you want to watch the charger game. They play the game surround & even our song :) all smiles for this San diegan fan. 

Best part....BYOF...yup bring your food it is welcomed.
author: Priscilla N.

description:
¡THE GREATEST SAN DIEGO CHARGERS BAR IN THE WORLD!

Anyone claiming its a seahawks bar is simply mistaken. This place bleeds blue and gold.

http://www.chargers.com/multimedia/videos/Philip-Rivers-Highlights-Chargers-vs-Seahawks/3f866bbc-ef86-468c-a48e-b01f736f9090

See for yourself: 
http://instagram.com/dcsuperchargers
http://dcsuperchargers.com/
author: Mike L.

description:
The scene: PB-esque crowd who are Charger's fans.

San Diego SUPER CHARGERS San Diego SUPER CHARGERS...CHARGE!

Being in San Francisco, Charger's fans may be far and few, but you wouldn't know that if you were here at Danny Coyle's on a Sunday! This place is packed (like a hot sweaty dance club in Vegas kind of packed) and your eyes will be delighted by the sea of navy blue, powder blue and lightning bolts adorning everyone surrounding you. Your ears will be delighted (and amused) by the chants and although you may not be at the Q, this is a pretty good runner up. As others have mentioned, you can bring your own food and I saw a food truck right outside this place. It does get super hot and stuffy so don't come wearing your peacoats and scarves.
author: Emily C.

description:
Been going to Danny Coyles for as longs as its been open  . Best Pub in the height by far. 
Good Cocktails , Awesome Bartenders, Excellent Sport bars.
author: Fergal M.

description: Moved away from sd and I'm thrilled there's a part of me here in SF. So many Chargers fans here. Feels just like home!
author: Nancy N.

description:
Even though this bar is three doors down from my house ( which happens to be my favorite band)...  I love this place. 

Just kidding about the band.

 You know what I am not kidding about???... The friendly smiles and strong drinks I receive from the DC's  staff. Who is my favorite bartender you ask? I don't know... EVERYONE. 

Even though this place is my unofficial living room, I recommend it to locals, tourists, first dates, break up dates, and legit sports fans.

The only downside is they 'Accept' and 'Like' Seahawks fans. boo. hiss.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
Recently moved to the neighborhood, but have been coming to Danny Coyle's for years now.  This is definitely my favorite bar in the city, given the great atmosphere, friendly bartenders/owners, and game day environment.

My friend and I are die hard Seahawk fans, and while this is primarily a Chargers bar, we've quickly grown a strong stable of Hawk fans for every Sunday.  Typically, the Chargers fans get the back room (w/ projector), while we occupy the front.  If you're a Seahawks fan in SF, then this is your bar!!!

Oh, and who can beat the $2.50 Tecate specials on Sunday?  

Danny Coyle's = Best bar in the city!
author: Jerome Z.

description:
$96 for 16 shots of fireball?  not bad!  i forget how much cheaper this area is compared to the marina.

danny coyle's was pretty empty on the most recently saturday night that i went, but i since i went with a group of 20+ people, it was fun as shit.  the jukebox in the back has a GREAT selection of songs, so i spent a long time lurking next to it.... and then dancing / acting like a crazy person / dancing. 

the other time i came here was during some soccer match a couple years ago.  that time i went, it was SO PACKED, and i could barely move at all.  i ended up leaving because it was bat shit crazy inside / full of dudes yelling at the TV.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Check them out for trivia night! Wednesday night gets a good lil crowd, there are DJ's that come play who aren't half bad! Great bar to get together at with friends before you head out for the night, or even for brunch on the weekends (read:hangover recovery spot)!
Food is priced fair & is definatrely good. Huge portions. My favorites include a veggie burger with cheese and the tacos!
author: Kelli G.

description:
Served the purpose for me to watch the NY Giants game.Good set up with a lot of TV's and they maximize their space in not the biggest location.

Like my Yelp homey Rachael S said, it seems to bring some fratatellos d-bags but you'll pretty much get that at every sports bar in some way or another.

In between drinking my cold $5 Stellas I had to overhear some insecure ex state school bros talk about their "stories" from last night about "sniping bj's" and "bagging but titty babes." I would have thought this is normal had they not been 35.

Still a cool spot in a cool neighborhood to watch a game.

Cons: don't serve food which really sucked but they let you bring in stuff. There is Katz's bagels and pizza right across the way.

Also-not sure if this is a pro or a con but I saw at least 4 dogs in there. Is this an SF thing? Kinda cool.
author: Bobby C.

description: After checking out some of the reviews, I understand why some people gave it 5 stars: they were Chargers fans. What I didn't see is any mention of the Seahawks. When we were there trying to watch the Niner game the rowdy Seattle fans parked themselves right near the door to make for an awkward entry and exit. The bartender was kind of slow and forgot about the second pull on my Guinness too, though he's not the first person to do that. We took our business to Nicky's and enjoyed it more over there.
author: Marty J.

description: Came here after Bay to Breakers. The crowd is mixed and people seemed happy and friendly
author: Mia X.

description:
Continuing my crawl down Haight in pursuit of the "Soused" badge, we ended up here. Decent little bar, had the pub vibe, but it was a total sausage fest on a Tuesday night. 

Good beer selection, sports on the tellys, soccer and the Giants playing. Kind of a small joint, and relatively crowded early, so we didn't stay for very long.

Would check it out again, but hoping the male:female ratio is a bit better for the next visit.
author: Jonathan M.

description: Absolutely had a Terrific time!! We picked it out of the directory and it was one of the best flying fickle of fate finds for our day.  We walked in, and were hungry, we asked for a suggestion and he directed us to a place he goes for grub.  Then we headed back for a Guinness to celebrate. :) That lead to another and another, by the way it was also our marriage day... And the bar was the perfect follow to that joyous spirit. We hung out for hours just simply enjoying the surroundings.  We will be visiting again when we come back to town. =)
author: Kara J.

description: Brian and his crew are great. Remember your face, good happy hour drinks. Most importantly it's a great atmosphere
author: Joshua L.

description:
Trivia wednesday night was AWESOME. (Cue the overexcitedness.) The bathrooms were clean! So many TVS!! Ringing a bell when the Giants score and then win the game??? How freaking cool?!

But I'm bummed you don't have cider on tap to make a poor mans black velvet.  =/ But my Guinness was the best draft Guinness I've ever had!
author: Emily D.

description: Typical sports bar. Nice place to catch the game with some friends, but nothing too special. Would come here to watch a game again.
author: Lauren P.

description: So, it pains me to write this review, as I have recently moved away from the Lower Haight, as well as SF itself.  The "DC" has been my Cheers for the last 4 years, and I miss it daily.  If you are looking for a local neighborhood bar that pours a mean Guinness and has amazingly friendly bartenders, look no further.  Great jukebox and a wide variety of characters/regulars to help make your night one to remember (or forget).  Also, a great place to come and sit and have a cocktail when you're alone, as you won't be alone for long!  The best bar in SF by far!  Cheers!  Miss you DC!!!! XO
author: Meg G.

description:
Great spot for pub trivia that's close to my house. Tables set up throughout the place, as well as a ton of chairs along the bar. There are about 7(?) TVs so you can take your pick in terms of sports/politics channels.

Huge plus: free chips and salsa throughout the night for pub trivia! You can even pick between red, green or guacamole.

Although the bartender is pretty hot, our team was a little disappointed for different reasons: he never asked if we'd like a second round of drinks (we were sitting at the bar), and he kept people waiting for drinks for a relatively long time. I kept glancing over at him not only because he was cute, but because I was parched dammit!

1 Newcastle + 1 coke = $7.50
author: Alyssa G.

description:
Up until recently, my only experience at DC's was for Chargers games. I'm not a Chargers fan at all (I'm not marking this place down for that...honestly), but I still think this place is A-OK. To be honest though, I did have a better time here on my non-game day experience. 

There's nothing that really stands out about this place, for better or for worst. It's divey, which is fine by me. They serve alcohol, which is DEFINITELY fine by me. What else? Hmmm...I kind of wish they had more seating, there's that. The drink prices are reasonable (actually, I think they're pretty cheap...at least based on my tab to alcohol consumed ratio on my last visit). The bartenders seem nice. 

Honestly, I think the one main problem I have with this place (and I'll admit, it has nothing to do with the place itself) is that I don't really like any of the other bars in the area. This would be fine if I LOVED Danny Coyle's, but I don't. I'm a mover and a shaker so I like to bar hop, and I can't do that in the Lower Haight. Oh, and I wish this place served food.
author: George A.

description: Awesome place to catch a Sounders game when put of town. :) Thank you Fog City Faithful for being so welcoming! :)
author: Sarah C.

description:
The fist time I hung out at Danny Coyles, I was told that it was a Chargers bar! So naturally, on my next visit I had to come back when I was in town for the Cowboys/ Chargers game.
I never expected the amount of people that came out to show their love for the San Diego team.
By the time the game started (which was displayed on the very large projection screen) the place was packed wall to wall with people decked out in the Blue and Gold.
Even though the place was overflowing, the bar tenders did an awesome job of keeping all of us filled up on shots and beers.

The only little downfall is that they don't have a kitchen, but they let you bring in food from outside.
Cant wait to come back for another Chargers game.
author: Noel J.

description: Trivia night on Wednesdays. Super fun and super difficult, but the drinks are pretty cheap, and the place isn't too crowded.
author: Danny C.

description: I don't know why I didn't give it 5 stars. It's my favorite bar ever. Maybe because it's not off the BART? But's it's off of N-Judah. It's gonna be the new place to watch tennis!!! Tennis fans will finally have a home! :)
author: Leena B.

description:
This is most definitely my local bar/favorite bar in lower Haight. 

It's an Irish bar...like EVERY bar in lower Haight, and it's awesome! It's also one of two bars that serves liquor in lower Haight and they have an excellent selection of top-notch stuff.

I started going here because a friend lives two doors down, and we'd go mostly to watch Giants/49ers games. It gets crazy packed and served for an unbelievable venue when the Giants  won the World Series. Sometimes there are also DJ's for holidays, like St. Patty's Day.

Then we just started going to have a beer during the week, and it's perfect for that too. They don't serve food, have a few snack for sale, but you are totally allowed to bring in food from anywhere. (I suggest Wing Wing's or estrella taqueria)

The owner is incredibly nice, and he takes the time to get to know the regulars. It's kind of fun that many of the bartenders are Irish, and many of them are hottttt. 

The bouncer on weekends, or game/fight nights is Alfonzo, and he is DA best. He sometimes works in full-on Mad Men suits and you just want to be his friend. 

I LOVE THIS BAR.
author: Chloé M.

description:
What can i say about this place that hasn't already been said. Best Charger Bar in the world...Yes, great prices $2.50 for a tecate or $5 for tecate and shot of tequila(usually during games only), great bartenders, good people (i have met some great friends here). Even if you are not a charger fan they still show all types of games or matches here whether it's baseball, futball, hockey or even MMA and if it's not on just ask and they will usually put it on they cool like that. 
     Outside of the sports world this place has a jukebox ,trivia night, lets you bring in outside food, and sometimes has a food truck outside, allows dogs and takes credit/debit cards which is rare in sf.
author: Raul R.

description: Seahawks bar. Wtf. Jersey on the wall. We had to leave. They have fun trivia night. Normal beer selection.  Not too crowded.
author: Brian L.

description: being from Seattle this is one of the best Seattle Seahawks bars that I have ever been to in the city. When we first walked in all we could see were Seahawks fans wearing their jerseys to support the team from San Francisco. The staff year was awesome and really timely on getting us our drinks and very supporting of the amount of people that were at the bar. The bar was packed with Seattle Seahawks fans when we were playing the Forty Niners and it was a great game to go to. Now that it is playoff time, this will definitely be a place I will come back to. The staff here was extremely friendly and I have not had a chance to eat the food because it was too busy for me to even want to eat. But overall, this is a great place for Seattle Seahawks fans to go to if you are living in San Francisco area to go to to watch the Seattle Seahawks place an awesome football game.
author: Thaddius D.

description: A seahawks fan in San Francisco can be a bit sketchy but Danny Coyle's is the spot to watch a game.  It's also a Chargers bar so the line can get a bit long out the door to get in (especially if there's a Chargers game on at the same time as I found out last week) but this bar has an awesome vibe to watch the Hawks.  It should be mentioned that the doorman Alfonso is the man.  I don't envy trying to manage as many people in line as he has to, but he has a rad attitude and was super friendly to us as we slowly made our way up the line to get in.  Keep him around!  Go Hawks!
author: Rachel O.

description:
I came here for the Chargers vs Packers game and now I kinda get the hyphy massholes who live in PB... I mean people weren't d!cks in here but damn they were excited to watch some Chargers Football.. 

Teh fans in this place were more enthusiastic than an Oggi's Pizza Chula Vista crowd... Serio guey.

Anywayz $2.50 Tecates and a cool crowd.. Thnx for putting me on to this place Yelp.
author: Noe O.

description:
Came here with my roommate to watch the NHL Stadium Series on Feb. 21. I was a little disappointed at the lack of a hockey atmosphere considering how big they hyped it up, but they did put on the game for us, and as a Kings fan, it was nice to be able to chirp the Sharks and not get yelled at by Sharks fans (they lost anyway, so the joke would've been on them)!
I also liked that others at the bar just minded their own business with whomever they were with, so overall a very nice, laid-back atmosphere, which I'm sure gets much louder during baseball and football season!
author: Kristine R.

description: As a Chargers fan, this place is like home.  It's so great to be around other Chargers fans during games, especially in the Bay Area.  The atmosphere and energy during Chargers games is just awesome.  It gets VERY crowded during games, so get there early if you want a seat.  Even with the crowds, the bartenders are great and definitely know what they're doing.  We will definitely be back next weekend!  PS No food there, but you can bring your own food in.
author: Jackee K.

description:
Are you a Charger fan and have found yourself lucky enough to now reside in San Francisco? Looking for place to watch the Bolts put the smack down amongst your fellow Charger fans? Look no further, Danny Coyle's is the place to be for the Charger games!
So many of us in the place have the love for the Bolts, it exudes into the street. 
$2 Tecates! Check!
DC's does not serve food but they welcome you to bring any food from their many food establishment neighbors, peeps even get food delivered, right at their table in the bar.
The game is pretty much on every screen in the place but most important, always on the big screen. When we were there last, the 49ers were playing at the same time as the Chargers and who was on the big screen? The Bolts, of course!
Whenever we find ourselves in SF during football season, DC's is where we are on Sundays!
Go Chargers!!
author: Jennifer J.

description:
I like pubs because I like the casual atmosphere without the pretentious undertones of having to dress a certain way.  But there is a limit to the level of casualness for me, because when obvious drunks belt out an unrecognizable song at the top of their lungs at 8:30pm someone better stop them.  Thank you nice bartender for shutting them up.

I love how the windows open up for a nice summer's day and I love how they have tons of tv so it really doesn't matter where you're sitting because you're totally on top of the action.
author: Rosalind S.

description: Finally. I found a CHARGERS bar in San Francisco. They are also a Seahawks bar. I've been here on 3 Sundays since i've moved to san francisco a month ago and the place gets packed with Chargers fans during the game. After every touchdown they play the original San Diego Super Chargers song. Awesome! Game day specials are $2.50 for a can of Tecate. Not a bad deal. Several TV's throughout so they will play other games as well.
author: Steven K.

description: What a great Charger bar! This is by far the best one I've ever been to outside of San Diego. Brian the owner couldn't have been nicer and the locals made us feel very welcome. I loved the Tecate buckets and the tower fans make with the empties. I also scored a Danny Coyle's Charger fan t-shirt while I was there. A great time for the Charger-Seahawk game. I will definitely be back.
author: Greg S.

description: Best Chargers bar north of the 8! Found this gem after a frantic Yelp search for Chargers bars in SF the morning of the Bolts' home opener and what a fantastic, friendly and energetic place to be to enjoy the game! Plus, it doubles as an Irish pub the other 349 days of the year. This place rocks!
author: Terrence M.

description:
I came here to watch the Eurocup semifinal between Spain and Italy. We got the table by the window so it kind of felt like we were in Europe watching the game, with all the people watching through the window from outside. 

A typical Irish pub with all the typical Irish beers. Of course I had to be different (it was Sunday Funday, after all) and got a bloody mary. They make them super spicy. My boyfriend asked them to go light on the spice and got the reply "it's pre made" as the bartender continued to pour tabasco in. There was practically a fist fight to order any drinks before the match, so spicy bloody marys for all.

Have yet to try the food or catch this place on a non crazy day, but looks like it's a contender for one of the best Irish puts in Lower Haight.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Great bar!  my friends complained that the service was kinda slow...  but it was busy on a friday night and sheesh,  if i was in as much of a hurry as my friends to get a drink i should probably call betty ford...

huge selection of whiskey (they are irish) and lots of beers on tap.
author: Phoenix D.

description:
Tell me it was "Irish Heritage Night" at Danny Coyle's or something because they wuz reprezentin' last weekend during the Cal-Maryland game.

Props to Danny for having the NCAA Football DirecTV package; props to Danny for having one TV dedicated to English-Premiere League Soccer and every other futbol game.  More props to the DJ at Danny's for spinning "Passin' Me By" by the Pharcyde just before "Award Tour", a classic Tribe Called Quest tune on a Saturday night.
author: Dave K.

description:
Is it a good place to come after work?
You betcha.

Is it an Irish pub?
Not remotely.

Do they pour a mean Guiness?
Sure enough.

We meet here often after work.  It's a decent crowd for the most part, with many more men than women.  - Last time I was here that was not a good thing: after being very aggressively groped by a random man who sported the best mullet I've seen in a long time, nearby jock guys just leaned back and laughed.  Thanks for the help, dudes.  (BTW, the mullet-head's pick-up line was: "Don't worry.  I can touch you.  I can kiss you.)  Guys.  I print this here to let you know, this is *not* a good line.  Even when very drunk.  Even when very late at night.  Never.  Ever.

It's a shiny sports bar with good-looking bar tenders.  Good for after work cause it's close.  Drinks are fine.  Not worth trecking across town for though.  

Don't worry.  I can drink you.  I can sit you.
author: Ravena F.

description: I got my Manchester United Scarf for the game tomorrow! STOKED! So glad I found out about this place!
author: Kyle W.

description:
Love to come here for Weds trivia.  They let you bring in your own food so you can eat while you play.  Lots of good options nearby - Memphis Minnies, Ali Baba's Cave, Rosamunde, even Three Twins Ice Cream. 

My favorite trivia joint so far, even tho parking is a biaaatchh!!
author: Josie M.

description: I was diggin Coyle's the night my 9ers whooped some Steeler ass. Good ambiance, polite and attentive bartenders and a very nice location for a Irish pub. For those on a beer budget, they also have a nice deal on $2 tacates. They also provide a solid amount of TV's, highly recommended for watching a game of your choice.
author: Patrick O.

description: This bar has a great vibe starting with the door man ("GQ"Alfonso), bartenders (Dan "the man") and the Seahawks and chargers fans of course. Also the best and safest spot in San Francisco to watch a Seahawks game. Go Hawks!!!
author: Jova E.

description: A Chargers bar in SF?! Heck yes!! We got there a little bit late, which was a mistake because it's a small place and was PACKED. Everyone is decked out in Chargers gear, gotta love it! They have $2 Tecates and one of the best bloody mary's I've EVER had.  If you live in the Bay Area and love the Bolts, this is the place for you.  I was visiting from Las Vegas and was really surprised that this place actually existed.  Had a blast and saw my Chargers squeak out a big WIN versus the hated Donkeys!
author: Teri W.

description: Love this place! Live a couple of blocks away. This place is a great local spot.
author: Marc B.

description: Fun little hole in the wall. Good triva night.
author: Julia D.

description: Loved my experience here for the first time. Great service, very attentive, cheap beer 5$ for a bluemoon on tap. Awesome random music.
author: Shakei D.

description:
Sports up the wazoo here!  And I love wazoos filled with sports! What IS a wazoo anyway???

Danny Coyle's.....sports pub extraordinaire. Lower Haight so its not flowing with tourists. Across the way is Rosemundes which is a hipster haven for sausage lovers...and who doesn't love sausage? I know I do..heh heh ;) . They'll let you bring them back to the bar.

The bartenders are fast and can watch the game and serve at the same time! That's talent folks. Its a friendly environment and if you come on any given Sunday....you'll def feel like you're watching with a room full of friends.
author: Jay H.

description:
Such a bro-y bar.  Breeders.

Trivia here should be avoided unless you get there way early and have super human hearing.
author: Jeremy G.

description: Great bar to watch a game, I'm a San Diego native, so I can definitely agree this is the place to be! Last time I went was a Saturday night and it was uncomfortably hot and icky in there, it wasn't even that packed. Other than that, the service was good and quick! A ton of dudes as well, so ladies, this is definitely that place to be if you're single!
author: Samantha H.

description: Excellant !!!! Great service the bartenders are just exactly what you need, smart and entertaining and they definately know how to pour a perfect pint of Guinness
author: Geoffrey B.

description: Great place to watch MMA when they have a main event for only a $10 cover. Sine they don't serve food you have in and out privileges to go to nearby Japanese, BBQ, Mexican etc and bring it inside. I like that there were plenty of screens and places to sit. They kept picking up glasses and kept the place clean. A downside was it was too warm inside. Nice staff.
author: Jo H.

description:
So I have to say that I've never eaten here before... but I came here early to watch an EPL match when I was visiting and am definitely willing to come back and try food.

This is a great cozy pub to watch matches at... but beware and get there EARLY! Windows open out but it's a strictly residential area so if it gets too noisy (and let's not kid ourselves here it's the EPL) the windows need to be closed again. On a cold day it's not that big a deal... on a HOT day with all those sweaty people, well... I think you get the point.

The bar situation is pretty decent too and I had as good a service as can be expected considering it was packed that day. They have some decent beers on tap and the staff is quick and professional.

Only 3 stars because I haven't tried the food.
author: Wonder W.

description:
I'm keeping this one short and sweet - great drinks, great people, great vibe. This bar is one that, from what I can see, a lot of the neighborhood locals call home. The bartenders are awesome -- always chattin in up with their customers and talkin sports like like they do it for a living. I love comin to this place to watch the Giants game and to grab a brew after work. 

Sports lovers? Pay Danny Coyle's a visit.
author: Sara K.

description:
When I go into a bar, it should take approximately 2 seconds for the bartender to ask what I want. Why do I demand such a request? 

a) It's been a shitfest of a week.
b) I'm ordering something that will take 3 seconds.
c) I have bewbz.

Ok, so the first two don't matter. Do you have any idea how hard it is to get drinks from bartenders who ALSO have bewbz?!

Plus, why are you measuring out your drinks? I learned how to free pour in about 2 seconds. One, two, three, four. Please tell me, how hard is that of a concept to grab?

But you guys accepted credit cards. Plus one star. 

And have a back where I could put my stuff without worrying about it getting stolen. Except by the time I left the bar, I had no fucking clue what was going on ANYWAYS, and even left my credit card with the tab still open.

Oh and thanks for having my friend take my card for me. 

But the space in the back was kinda dark. 

And I got sneered at by a lot of people. WTF. Nice clientel, peoplez.

(disclaimer: this review was brought to you by Jaime's PMS. Again. Someone please take away her computer. kthxbai.)
author: Jaime L.

description:
Danny, I really want to love you for what you are, but your bar seriously smells like ass.

Danny has a lot of good things going for it. And I need a good sports bar in my life. Being a crazy obsessed San Jose Sharks fan (and hockey fan in general) and living with roommates who are diehard baseball fans, living 2 blocks away from Danny Coyle's should be a dream come true. They have a lot of nice TVs, make really good drinks (including my breakfast Bloody Mary), and have a nice selection of interesting Irish beers on tap. But what the hell? This bar smells ridiculously horrible and on game days it's way too over crowded. So if you like visiting bars where you can't breathe comfortably, this is your place.

I only resort to DC when I am seriously too lazy to walk an extra 2 blocks to Mad Dog. Which is never.
author: Michelle N.

description:
San Diego Chargers Fan? CHECK! 

Living in the bay area? CHECK! 

Appreciate $2 tecates on a sunday afternoon? CHECK!!!!!

if you fit any of those three and know how to really appreciate a good carne asada burrito you should only watch your chargers games here.  no they dont have any burritos here, but at least everyone here will share your sorrow on not being able to get a legit burrito like you could back in sd. 

out of towners who are charger fans, GET YOUR BUTT IN HERE ON SUNDAYS.  this place is filled with every type of chargers fans during the football season on game days!!
author: omid a.

description:
Yesterday was my first time at Danny Coyle and I thought to myself "Why haven't I been been here before??" Danny Coyle is one of the nicest and cleanest bar I seen. The interior is modern but old fashioned at the same time. i love how the fact they have open windows especially on a nice night like yesterday it was a perfect for drinks. There were 3 TV Flat screens, plenty of tables and chairs for seating and also a small private upstairs seating area if you want a little privacy. But one thing that seal the deal was the CLEAN bathrooms (3 private stalls!), i cant stand dirty bathrooms! 

Danny Coyle is known for their Pomegranate Mojitos (which is really GOOD!) plus they use Odwalla Pomegranate so you know its the good stuff. The bartender was really nice and the drinks are moderately priced ($8 Mojitos). Supposedly each day of the week there is a theme of the night. Wednesdays was Trivia night which i came out for my friend's birthday. The winner receive a $40 bar tab and sad to say my team placed last.  

5 stars = clean bar, good drinks, cheap beer, clean bathrooms, & good crowd.
author: Carol Y.

description: Great place to get away from 49er fans in San Francisco. Go Hawks!
author: Andy H.

description: Great service, nice people, and the Fog City Faithful! Nice to see that Sounders fans have a place to watch the games and celebrate together. It's cool that this place shows out of market games. We're telling everyone back home about Danny Coyle's!
author: Summer F.

description:
Danny Coyle's is such a great bar. The manager, is a bad ass from somewhere in London. Soccer on at 5am (if there's a game). Always willing to put on another sporting event if you are so keen on watching it. 

Rosamunde and Little Chihuahua are close walks by and you can bring your food in. Can get a bit crowded during FA Cup games or any other major sporting event. 

Best place to grab a pint of Guinness with some friends and forget about the "real world". Even if you have to remember it in the morning.
author: David N.

description:
Okay I guess this should be my first official Yelp. I dont count the party I dj'd for cause I killed it and whatever...

This is a CHARGERS BAR. Even though football season is almost over, and we didnt make the playoffs this place is special to Chargers fans, those that live in SF/Bay Area and those traveling that find us here. We tolerate the Seattle guys (actually nice cats but the Seaturkeys? cmon) But we have an NFL sanctioned, signed, framed Tomlinson jersey (D'OH) and they have a goodwill framed Hasselbeck photo on the wall. Brian Siobhan and Steve (my next door neighbor) are in turn very tolerant of our antics and keep the Tecate's coming. anytime the Bolts are playing you can find me here as long as it doesn't fall on one of my custody days! DANNY COYLES SUPER CHARGERS!!!!!!!!
author: Sonny P.

description:
It's been a busy week going to a bunch of AWESOME places for the first time - which has awakened my new Yelp reviews as I've clearly been MIA for a while. Danny Coyle's deserves one of my new reviews!

First time here on a sunny Sat afternoon and I can safely give my stamp of approval. If you were to judge a bar by how clean their restrooms are - I'd give this place 5 stars just on that because their restrooms are not only clean, they smell nice but also have quite the zen quality. You'd think you were at a Westin Hotel! 

Spacious, roomy, bar seats have PURSE HOOKS which is always a winner for us females, service is pleasant, great selection of whisky, scotch, bourbon, vodka, tequilia, etc. - and they keep the place clean. It sure doesn't hurt that Rosamunde and Memphis Minnie's are down the street and you can bring your grub in. 

No doubt, I will be back! Say yes to Bulliet Rye!
author: Jessica C.

description:
It took me forever to find a charger bar in san francisco, and since I don't have cable at my house anymore, the only way i can watch a charger game is by going to a bar.  I searched google forever, but no luck and I had almost given up hope when someone said I should check out danny coyle's.

With my fingers crossed I headed out this sunday for the game.  Walked into Danny Coyles and a sea of blue!   It was just like being in PB again.. but with cooler SF type PB'ers.  

The bar itself is a nice pub with an irish feel.  A moderate selection of beers, ton's of TV's, and solid alcohol selection. The bartenders are really nice and did their best to serve the capacity crowd.  I'll be here again next sunday for sure.

Anyway, to help other poor displaced charger fans like myself, I'm going to say "danny coyle's is a great charger bar in san francisco" one more time in hopes that google picks it up.
author: Nathan M.

description:
Lots of TVs. Good drinks. Cheap beers. Potato chips behind the bar. 

I love this place on football Sunday. Granted, it gets PACKED for games, but the people that you meet in the bar are all down-to-earth and cool to share tables with. For Sunday games, they also have the projector going with the Chargers game on, and PBRs for $2. There's usually another beer for $4 (in the past it's been bottles of Sam Adams). Wells are usually pretty inexpensive as well.... trust me.... the last thing I need at 10am is a beer... so I usually start off with a screwdriver.

Feel free to bring food from anywhere else into the bar. We've brought in BBQ from Memphis Minnies, pizza from Mythic, and sausages from Rosamunde. One sunday, there was even a food truck parked outside (GENIUS!!!!) The only sucky thing is that you have to call in your food outside, because cell service inside the bar is pretty crappy.

This place makes me feel like I'm home... in PB.... watching the game with the bros :)
author: Mar A.

description:
Danny Coyle's would be my ideal neighborhood bar if I lived in San Francisco.  With a great staff and regular drink specials, this non-pretentious and sports savvy bar provides everything a 20 something like myself needs, futbol (soccer), good drinks, and some free parking in the surrounding streets.

A big shout out to Steve for his famous Bloody Mary's on the weekend and for always having the San Jose Earthquakes and Tottenham Hotspurs fixtures on.

With so many bars in San Francisco, it's amazing how I always end up at Danny Coyle's before my stay is over.
author: A.J. P.

description: A great atmosphere for watching sports. And from what I could tell, they had a pretty good beer selection (not so much wine, but if you're there to watch sports, you probably want beer anyway!)
author: Katie B.

description: Sizable Irish pub littered with LCD screens running ESPN. Drew huge crowd on St. Patty's. Small dance floor in the back.
author: Robin H.

description:
Good beer specials and fun scene. Worth stopping in!

This bar is in a great neighborhood with a chill vibe.  The guy behind the bar even has the accent. The accent! Give it a shot!
author: Don G.

description:
Alyssa G. and I have been hitting up the Danny Coyle's pub-trivia night semi-regularly for the past couple of months--go team That's Spanish for Jesus!  The trivia itself is fun and really challenging, but why can't we get someone on our team who knows anything about music from the years 1 through 1981?  

OK, rant aside (I'll leave it for a future pub-trivia review), this place is all right.  It's appointed very nicely, and I could imagine it being very interesting to watch a sporting event in here.  But it's not exactly comfortable, and there's a distinct lack of chairs and barstools, which is weird because this is, um, a bar.

I think I would normally go with four stars just because it's nice enough and they allow you to bring food in here (the sushi place next door will even deliver to the bar), but it loses a star because one of their bartenders is a jerk who helped a particular team, which ended up winning that night, by cheating; he took the sheet around the bar and asked people to identify photographs.  Dude, other people are playing too.
author: John S.

description:
Gotta say it has become one of my favorite spots to grab a drink with friends. The bartenders are great! They remembered my name and drink of choice after the first time meeting them. 

I also love coming here to watch sports. They have several big TVs that are placed perfectly so you can watch the game from anywhere in the bar. The bar itself is attractive and has a warm feel to it.

Best of all, it's very easy to get to from my house on Muni!
author: Terry K.

description:
I'm not really a sports bar type of girl, but I really liked this place. We stumbled in here after our stint at Bay to Breakers. First thing I noticed was how bright it was inside, with tons of natural light coming in. It was crazy crowded, but I didn't have any trouble criss crossing the space multiple times, or getting into the (VERY clean!) bathroom. They were playing the Celtics-Magic game, which no one was really paying attention to, as well as the Sharks game on multiple screens. They had a freaking giant projection screen showing the hockey game! The bartenders were very friendly, accommodating our vegetarian bloody mary requests and offering up conversation when I managed to lose my group within the bar. 

Apparently this is the designated Chargers bar, so when I move here I have a place to go when I'm feeling homesick for San Diego! Woo!
author: Natalie U.

description: Good service with decent selection. Abundant bathrooms. Internet jukebox. Smells nice (for a bar).
author: Kyle C.

description: Love this place - the local neighborhood sports bar. Go Sports!
author: danni r.

description: #1 seahawks bar in san francisco. brian, the owner, is regularly working the bar and the drinks are great. there are rotating deals that are usually good. no kitchen, but you can bring in any food you want. i go all the time, great neighborhood bar.
author: Michael J.

description: Green beans and pearl onions? I had considered sardines, Guinness, and celery, but never green beans and pearl onions in my bloody mary. This was a serious game changer and I am now on a mission to find something similar in nyc.
author: Steph G.

description:
Danny Coyle's is a great place to watch a game.  There is a decent amount of seating, the bartenders actually card people to keep the 'young people' out, and there are tons of TVs and a huge projector to watch your game of choice.  There were plenty of soccer fans who turned out for an 11:30am Sunday soccer match, and I've read they will be open at 4:30am for those die-hard fans.  Beer selection is respectable, fewer options than Toranados (Chimay and Duvel) but more traditional (Guineess, Stella, Blue moon).

Overall, a great place to hang out
author: T. M. B.

description:
So I am on  my way home to SD from SF and of course I book my flight until WELL after the Chargers game so that I don't miss it.   My flakey friend who was supposed to meet me to watch the game didn't come through so I turned to my BFF yelp (is that sad?) and searched "San Diego Chargers Bar."  Danny Coyle's came up.  I trekked it there, big suitcase and all, and arrived to what looked like an average pub.  There was a Christmas tree in the corner and I pushed my suitcase behind it and got to work.  Bloody Mary was mediocre.  Then I hit the Speakeasy on tap.  Yum.  After trying to mix in with the rowdy fans I realized that there was no room and found a lone Chargers fan next to the only empty seat in the house and plopped down next to him.   Things were slow at first but the more we scored the rowdier it got.   "San Dee-aygo Super Chaaaargers" was belted many times.  I saw more cool Chargers paraphernalia there than I have seen in all of San Diego!  Vintage button downs, Mitchell and Ness T's, and even their own "Dany Coyle's Super Chargers" gear (someone please tell me where to get it)  

I am meeting people left and right listening to everyone's San Diego stories and a chick decked out in head to toe Chargers gear grabs my hand and hauls me to the rowdy end of the bar where a tray of Don Julio awaits.  Two shots later we are all friends for life and my suitcase gets placed behind the safety of the bar by a nice gentlemen.  Of course the Chargers beat the Bangles and they play the entirety of the Super Chargers song over the speakers and everyone sings along.  It was probably the most fun I have ever had singing that song!  

If ever in SF again on a Super Sunday I will be there....
author: Juliana M.

description:
Great, i can go all the way to the marina without leaving my neighborhood  (ok Its not really that bad).

Danny Coyles is one of the two establishments in lower haight that has a hard alcohol license, It's pretty unlikely that you will enjoy both of them however as they are nearly on opposite ends of the spectrum.

Also, when I go in this place, its usually not that crowded, but there are not exactly a lot of places to sit.
author: Michael E.

description:
I am giving this place 2 stars for one reason only. This bar does not know how to control its rowdy, disrespectful patrons and they do not respect the neighbors that live around them. I have been to many bars that reside in neighborhoods (gay bars) and I can say that they really respect the people that live around them by keeping the noise down. 

This bar could care less about that. I have witnessed this bar opening their doors to rowdy guest as earl as 5am. Loud music, screaming and hooting and hollering. Why the bar feels the need to keep their front and back doors open to let the noise travel far is beyond me. Also I have seen their guest climbing and setting up a smoke camp outside peoples front steps until 2am. Whoever owns this place does not seem to care much about the people that live around them and who have to maybe work in the morning.

This place is a great bar, but they really need to start taking lessons from Castro and SOMA gay bars and learn how to keep the noise levels down and control their guest.
author: Robert Shawn W.

description:
Overall, this was not my favorite pub I've been to. It was clean and spacious inside, but it didn't have a lively pub atmosphere. It felt like a typical sports bar based on the number of TVs and the fact they were playing baseball, soccer and golf simultaneously.

I ended up at Danny Coyle's with some co-workers on friday night because we couldn't find a table at Bean Bag. We ended up getting a table here, at a place with decent lighting, fair bartenders and Journey playing on the electronic jukebox.

The place seemed like it had potential

I looked at the tabletop menus and ordered a pint of Magners but was informed after they opened a bottle that they didn't have it draft and the menu must have been a misprint. One of my friends got a cocktail, which was strong and well prepared. I probably should have ordered that instead, but oh well.
