The crowd wasn't very big, but there was one obnoxiously loud older gentleman who probably wanted to kill himself when his baseball team lost.  He was quite amusing to watch, but I didn't mind that we only stayed at Danny Coyle's for our first round.

It seems like a find neighborhood joint, but not a place I'd make the effort to go back to. Overall, a very "meh" experience.
author: Stephanie H.

description: I really have nothing bad to say about the bar facility. It's nice, and has a great Irish style pub feel to it(obviously)... But my friend and I went to Danny Coyles one Saturday morning to watch English Premier league Soccer. The bartender was friendly and the atmosphere was nice. But a day later I go to use my debit card and it wouldn't work. I checked my statements and realized Coyles had charged for 2 purchases...one being 16$ for my soda and my friend had a few whiskey and cokes. The other purchase was for 40$. I had no idea what it was for, but I knew for sure I didn't spend an even 40$ there, on a second purchase. Since it being the end of the month and my bills auto-deducting from my checking account, the 40$ over drafted me. (Plus an overdraft fee) I called Coyles and the person working seemed willing to help. They wrote down my number and said they would call the next day. I heard nothing. I called again, and this time I was given the cold shoulder and treated like I was accusing them of stealing. I was very calm and polite and made sure I mentioned to him that I was just inquiring as to what was going on. They said the owner would contact me the next day. The next day my bank called and said that Coyles had cancelled the purchase, so I checked to see with my own eyes, and sure enough it was reversed. I never heard from any owner or anything. I was disappointed because it was actually a great place to watch a soccer game, and because it was a nightmare to get the situation worked out. Make sure you monitor your card if that's how you're paying.
author: Luke C.

description:
This place gets a 5 star rating from me purely from my Saturday night experience.

My group of friends was celebrating a birthday over at Toronado when all of a sudden the birthday boy annouced that he wanted an Irish Coffee. Ok- let's do this! I pulled out my Yelp! app and typed in irish coffee and lo and behold Danny Coyle's popped up. I've been there before to watch hockey games and I believe I've played trivia there once or twice (not enough to remember it being as good as everyone says it is), but never to drink irish coffees so I figured I should call first. And I suspected (with it being a bar) that the phone would just ring and ring. THE BARTENDER PICKED UP! On the second ring. I was so in awe that I think I sat on the line not speaking for a moment until the bartender was like, "umm, hello?" "Oh- hi! We were wondering if you serve irish coffees." "We do." "If we were over there in 15 mins would that work?" "Sure, I'll brew a fresh pot of coffe." "I love you (my group told me to say this)." "I love you too." Major swoon! 

What do you know, 15 mins later, we step into Danny Coyle's and not only does the smell of fresh brewed coffee fill the bar, but he is warming up the glass coffee cups. Needless to say it was the best $8 Irish Coffee I've ever had. Best service I've had in a bar in SF.
author: Melissa N.

description:
I know I belong here.

1) Stiff cheap drinks.
2) Busy but not packed.
3) My kind of people - while standing outside with one of the regulars, we were watching someone across the street moving a couch.  They dropped it down a flight of stairs.  The regular yelled "PIVOT!" 

When molotov's is overrun with Santas, Danny Coyle's offered me safe haven.  At least until I join the Santas next year.

Shamrock.
author: Archie R.

description:
I love this place. Wish I still lived in San Francisco to keep coming here.

My brother and I would come here for big footy matches. Every US national team soccer match, we'd be here and there would always be a good crowd. The SF chapter of the American Outlaws have even made it there official home bar. The bartenders rule, they will make you a stiff drink, and the cheap Tecates are always appreciated. 

Though I would normally knock a star off for serving zero food, the bartenders and the general ambience and atmosphere of the place makes up for it (not to mention that they let you bring food in). The place reminds me of my favorite bar here in Albuquerque. As soon as I move back to The City (hopefully sometime in the near future) I will make every attempt possible to be within walking distance to this place. A very chill, laid back neighborhood bar that, if you visit it enough, will earn your sentimental feelings.
author: Kevin W.

description:
A great place to watch a soccer (football) game in San Francisco.

Have enjoyed being there in the afternoon for a game, the evening or at the break of dawn.

A few weeks ago I got several friend together to watch some World Cup Qualifiers that started at 7 am and the doors were open and the bartenders ready to pour a beer with a smile.

I used to go to Mad Dog but it is not as friendly to soccer as it used to be.  Danny Coyles is now the place to go.  For the USA vs. Honduras World Cup Qualifier,  Danny Coyles was one of only thirty bars in the country that you could watch the game.  There was a crowd out the door watching the game!

They had a good selection of beers, and a great atmosphere.  The only reason I don't give it five stars is there is no food served there so you have to go across the street to Katz Bagels for some grub during a morning round of watching games.

I can live with that.
author: Douglas Z.

description:
My first attempt at finding a Chargers bar in the Bay Area leaves me feeling a bit torn.

I do like your inviting motif of the irish bar, yet I don't enjoy the $7 I spent for a white russian.  This is Sunday morning at 9:30am, not Saturday night on the Vegas strip. (ok ok maybe I'm exaggerating but still, that's a bit steep for a cocktail in a neighborhood bar)

I like the sweet setup for football watching.  Plenty of hd screens all around and a big projector in the back.  I didn't enjoy the vibe of the crowd.  Rowdy is good, just not douchebag angry rowdy.  What's so hard about relaxing and watching the game?

Perhaps they have some more reasonably priced drink options.  It would be nice if there was some sort of bar food, but no dice.  Kudos to being a Chargers bar with a good sound system to go with all those tv's, but more work is needed.
author: Bennett L.

description: THE Charger bar in SF. Every Sunday (or Monday, Thursday) it's like going home. I look forward to hanging out with all the fellow Charger fans, who have been going there for years. And in the offseason, it is a big gaping hole in the week. It is and always will the a Charger bar, all Bolts are welcome!
author: C C.

description:
Not to copy my BF, but this has become my FAVORITE bar to frequent.
It's clean, cute, plays good music - not too loud, there's always a spot to sit (OK - I'm old), easy to get a drink, and most importantly the bathrooms are clean. One minor complaints that isn't really a complaint, I wish they still allowed people on the back patio (what is it with neighbors complaining about back patios, if you don't like noise, don't live above a bar or cafe)....oh and sometimes I wish they served food!
author: Kate O.

description:
Pretty much the best sports bar in the City, at least for me. I'm hesitant to say so because I don't want too many people to know about it.

The bartenders are overworked but don't worry, they know you're there and they'll get to you. The beer selection is nothing special but it's all you'll need and reasonably priced ($5 for a pint - whose complaining?). The atmosphere is, well, it's an Irish pub - it's just what you think.

It gets crowded for big events, and you might have trouble getting a seat. Hence I had to knock off a star. But really, there'd be something wrong with the place if it wasn't crowded, right?
author: John R.

description:
Danny Coyles is a major reason the lower haight is one of the places to be these days.

The staff are wonderful! Owner Brian Coyle is extremely nice, extremely talented, and knows all of his patrons by name, practically! The bar itself is very well kept, clean, classy, but very down to earth. There's a small dance floor and they often have djs on the weekends for a younger crowd. Great place to watch a game, have a party or just hang out with friends. 

Oh, and did i mention super fresh ingredients for delicious drinks, like pomegranite margaritas???? love!
author: Piper P.

description:
This place makes me wish I drank a lot more.

Shows UFC events, friendly staff, great crowd, great bathrooms, thumbs up.

Even though there are 100s of bars closer to me I'd rather make the short walk up Haight St to this friendly destination.  This is strictly a bar, no kitchen but you can bring food in which to me is even better.  

Futbol (soccer) is the favorite sport on the tube but this place goes out of their way to arrange the sporting event you want on one of their many conveniently located flat screens.  They are showing PPV UFC events for $10 which is great, nothing is better than enjoying a night of great fights at a place like this.

What firmly makes this my #1 favorite bar in the city is the ownership and staff.  Nice people with no attitude!
author: Mitch M.

description:
I am reluctant to tell people how awesome Wednesday night trivia at Danny Coyle's is, because I want to make sure I can continue getting a table there. Even though it's more of a hike for me to come here than go to Martin Mack's in Upper Haight, it's just... better. I like the trivia MC (I think his name's Tony), and it's a cute little venue with reasonably priced drinks. They take cards. The male bartender puts lemon in my coke. Mmm. It can get packed when there are big games on, but isn't that the point? It's also a cool place to hang out on a weekday afternoon.

Edit: Tip - order from the male bartender, Dan, whenever possible. He's awesome!
author: Lara C.

description:
I came here to watch the late morning Europa League final. Good place with plenty of space. Large bar and a plenty of TVs (I think there is a projection tv as well). Good selection of beer, so you won't be disappointed. I look forward to going back to watch more matches while in SF.

My one disappointed is that they didn't server food since it was lunch time and I was getting hungry.
author: Daniel A.

description: I live two blocks from this bar and it has become my favorite local bar.  They play charger's games during football season which I love.  I also love that they allow dogs and have a dog bowl by the jukebox so my little pups don't go thirsty.  It is a fun, mellow place most of the time but can get crowded on weekends and during sports events.  A lot of my friends love this place cause they play all the soccer games at odd hours of the night/day.  Also they have good happy hour and beer specials.
author: Julie B.

description: One of the best places to watch a sporting event in a small place.  But I have to say the bartender/owner...  THEEE BEST.  Very courteous, attentive.
author: Demanding T.

description:
As one of the few bars in the Haight where I don't have to worry about bumping into a guy I've led on in the past, Danny Coyle's holds a place in my frozen, man-eating, ain't-no-bar-safe-no-more heart.

I would tell you this is my come-to spot on Saturday nights, but since I've led on half of the Internet, then my secret would no longer be safe, and fisticuffs or kidnapping might ensue.

The bartenders are hotties, guys outnumber girls 3x1, the lighting slowly grows dim, the jukebox sometimes makes way for a DJ, and  the customers appear to have good hygiene practices and carry few periodontal diseases.

Last night, we ordered some stiff drinks and four red-headed slut shots.  According to some bystanders, after I take red-headed sluts, I smile like one.  Who knew?!
author: Janney B.

description:
I am not a football fan. I am a fan of cheap light beer. So 11pm at Danny Coyle's is perfect. Miller Lite is $3 all weekend in honor of football, but football isn't actually being watched. Sure, the requisite ESPN clips are running over and over, but it's drowned out by a DJ spinning hip-hop and people conversing.

That same beer at 11am surrounded by people yelling at the TV would be considerably less enjoyable.
author: Jason B.

description: So this is the bar closest to my flat that plays European football matches. You know, Chelsea vs Barça or Ireland vs Croatia. I watched every European Cup game here, well, save for 2 or 3 games. Why not five stars Klik? Well they don't serve food, that would be dope. But they'll let you bring in whatever food you want and there are a bunch of places in the area to get food. Hell, order from Sushi Raw and they'll deliver it to you at the bar. The other downside is that people smoke right outside and there really isn't any place to avoid the smoke. I know, that's a pretty lame thing to complain about but still. I've watched two World Cup finals here, literally dozens maybe even a hundred or more Premier League, Champions' League and La Liga matches here and just to put the cherry on top I watched the last 4 innings of Matt Cain's perfect game here. So yeah, I like coming here.
author: Klik W.

description:
Not surprisingly, it was packed at 6pm on St. Patrick's Day. However, it was still possible to move through the crowd and I give the bartenders props for being as quick and attentive as one could reasonably expect. A barback was roaming the floor collecting empties throughout. The bathroom is rather cramped and entirely visible when the door opens, so decide ahead of time whether you're feeling exhibitionist!

TRIVIA: The association of the shamrock with Ireland and St. Patrick's Day is based on the belief that he used the 3-leaf clover to explain the Holy Trinity to the pagans he sought to convert.
author: Bill B.

description:
I grew up in San Diego and have lived here just over 9 years.  HOW IN THE HELL DID I NOT KNOW ABOUT THIS BAR UNTIL LAST WEEK????!!!!!  I'm a huge San Diego Chargers fan and watched my first game at Danny Coyle's today.  I had a blast!!!  I got to meet some great people and drink a few $2 Tecate's.

I'm going back every Sunday that I can.
author: Chris M.

description:
As a gal that moved here from NC, I can't help but love a bar that sports my fave Carolina BLUE! :) The bartenders are awesome, the space is cozy (but never cramped) and the drinks are decently priced. 

I'm here *every* Thursday night, what can I say? Kinda love it ;)
author: linda t.

description: Come early for trivia to get seats! It was fun. Nothing to remarkable about this place
author: Alexandra H.

description:
I love it when both the fiance and I agree on a place, and Danny Coyle's is one of those places. It's perfect for him because he doesn't like night clubs, scenes, dance floors or anything the he thinks is trendy. I like it because though it's casual, the people hanging out don't totally look like they just rolled out of bed, and no one is smelly. (had problems with smelly people at bars recently). Also if you wanna wear a cute shirt and jeans to go out you can do that here and not feel like you didn't go anywhere all weekend. 

It's a pub, and it's clean and polished and there is even a DJ I think on weekends, where part of the back area becomes an impromptu dance floor. So though it's not a club, if I want to dance to some cheesy music I can get that urge out here and my fiance doesn't have to be miserable. 

Great for hanging out with friends. They even let us bring our own jello shots in. 

Parking is a challenge though and since I don't live nearby I and parking is so tough I won't be here as often as I'd like.
author: Denise B.

description:
What better way to wile away a Saturday afternoon, post-girls' brunch and boozey shopping spree, than sipping Bloody Marys and screaming along to The Killers with good friends at Danny Coyle's? I honestly can't come up with one good alternative. Thank you, Nadja, for insisiting we head over to meet you just when we were hitting the peak of our morning binge-drink.

Saturday Brunch Club invaded Coyle's for a raucous good time this Saturday. What fun! What drink specials! What an awesome music selection! There was drinking, dancing, and merrymaking. And parking. Right out front. It was pretty quiet in there, and we were 6 of only about 10 people in the bar, so no one minded us ladies jumping around, dancing, and singing along. Plus, this bar is CLEAN. It's pleasant. It's spacious! Nice bathrooms, too!

Good times! Nice bartender! I'd come meet friends here anytime. I just probably wouldn't go out of my way to make this a regular spot, as it's nowhere near my house. If this is your neighborhood bar, I strongly suggest you become a regular here.
author: Autumn K.

description: Good spot, good crowd, nice people, fun trivia night on wednesdays...winners get $40 bar tab, And its $2 Tecates! Dark, home-y, local atmosphere.
author: LeighAnn B.

description:
The best part about moving to a new city is discovering things in your neighborhood that you never knew were there. For me, it's been the whole Lower Haight area and it keeps delighting me with discoveries and every time I walk up here, i wonder why I don't hang here more.

Last night's adventure included a stop in to Danny Coyles for a coworkers bday. I didn't really know what to expect, but liked that there were a mix of things and styles going on here. Kinda like a cocktail, if you will...

1 part sports bar
1 part fun trivia night
2 parts decent red wine choice
1 part cool bartenders
3 splashes of eye candy
Finish with a lime.

Yeah, I'd drink a Danny Coyle again :)
author: Stephy S.

description:
I haven't been serenaded since that stalker I had back in 1998. He waited for me in the parking garage of my work and sang me a song about all of the places we had been and all of the special memories we shared during our year long sham of a relationship. It was almost sweet, had it not been a little psycho. Anyhow, yes, that was the last serenade I received......

until I came to Danny Coyles. Within 5 minutes of settling down with my Magners (it was a warm Saturday afternoon, and I was in an Irish bar, with my girlfriends....what else would I drink??) I had a lovely Irish gentleman, who, himself, had had quite a few Magners, saunter up to me.....I mean REALLY close up to me, and sing me a song while he strummed his electric air guitar, with wah wah pedal sound effects and all. I hear the look on my face was priceless, but you should have seen the gals staring at me with that "WTF? Please don't let me laugh" look on their faces. 

This serenading looked like it was going to hit a round two about 45 minutes later, but the bartender yelled at my admirer to leave me alone so he quietly went back to his seat, leaving me and the girls to our hangovers and gossip. Hooray for a bartender who is aware of what is going on in her bar!

It must be noted that this is one of two bars in the lower haight that serve hard alcohol. It must also be noted that it is the newest looking Irish bar I have seen in the city (not sure this is good or bad, just noted), with the cleanest restrooms (this, on the other hand, is definitely good).
author: Drue C.

description:
I tried to go to Danny Coyle's without thinking of it in the context of the old An Bodhran. But it's impossible when its predecessor was one of the best neighborhood bars around. So it's impossible for me to even think about this new place without mourning all the things I miss about the old, dark, musty pub that was like a second home.

Truth be told, there are many bars like Danny Coyle's in Ireland... 

And they're in hotels. Bright, slick, and full of modern interior design, they're swanky and comfortable, but completely lacking in character. (Exception: The Octagon bar at U2's Clarence Hotel.)  The same holds for DC's.  

Between the plasma TVs, weenie digital jukebox, and wobbly high bar tables, this bar invokes the "I just got my first corporate job" bachelor pad more than it does a place to get a dose of the ol' Craic.  Especially without Guinness on tap (!) nor a kitchen serving up chips & curry.

On the bright side, they do have the cleanest bathrooms in the Lower Haight (it wouldn't take much, but they are indeed very nice), they kept the Strongbow tap, and they still draw a pretty cool crowd of neighborhood regulars.  They're also dog friendly, which means you have an assortment of cute pooches to play with as you wrack your booze-addled brain coming up with your answers for Monday night pub quiz.

Despite that, all I really want to say is fuck Danny Coyle and his fancy bar. I want An Bodhran back.
author: Omid T.

description:
Oh Danny Boy, the yelps, the yelps are calling. I was a fan of An Bodhran, and when Danny Coyle's replaced that fine drinking establishment, I wasn't sure of what to expect.

I stopped for the first time this Saturday afternoon, and the place was pretty busy (March Madness on the plasmas, don't you know). Getting a drink turned out to be a bit of a chore, but that Guinness was worth the wait. 

Danny Coyle's is good for the neighborhood - while it didn't feel like a true Irish pub, there is that sense of jovial (or drunken?) friendliness, which is good for something. And it is good for meeting up with friends, watching the game, that sort of thing, just nothing out of the ordinary. 

If you are lucky enough to grab one of the window seats during the day, then you might just be charmed enough to make this more of a regular destination. Also, if they start serving food, like an honest Shepherd's Pie, call me.
author: Nish N.

description:
I came here during a random night of drinking that started at a friend of my friends' housewarming up the street.

This place is an average pub, I was going to give it just two stars because the DJ was a Mac DJ, which was hella whack!  I hope on other nights they have a guy who is doing some serious spinning.

The reason it gets the extra star is because I learned it is a San Diego Charger bar!  GO CHARGERS!  Now I know a spot on this side of the city where I can go and be around other San Diegans!  Can't wait for next season!
author: Mark L.

description: Nice, but not a destination bar.  Surprisingly "classy" for the 'hood, and the prices reflect that.  Another reviewer mentioned that it's the type of bar where you could take your mom and I think that hits the nail on the head.  Personally, though, I wish I could have experienced it in its previous incarnation as a pub.
author: Valeria R.

description:
1) Who was the leader of USSR when Nixon was US president?
2) In what country was Monica Seles stabbed?
3) What school did Harry and Sally graduate from in "When Harry Met Sally"?
4) "Gettin' Jiggy With It" samples a song by what band?
5) Name the country with this flag: http://www.ri.net/schools/Smithfield/gms/walls/Mandela/Flagbig.GIF

If you can answer at least 3 out of the 5, you qualify to be part of my DC pub quiz team!  Honestly, I could only answer one of those (the tennis question)...I kinda suck.  I'm really just the secretary of our team.  I'm not sure why I go when I leave feeling kinda dumb.  But with the right team esp. with a music whiz, my team's won 1st prize a bunch of times, a $40 tab for Danny Coyle's.  So we keep coming back...

I've only been here for pub quiz on Wednesdays.  I've heard it can be a scene on the weekends.  The bar's puppy friendly and the bathrooms must be some of the cleanest in all of SF.  If you prefer dives, this may not be for you...but if you prefer cool nerds, this bar may be for you on Wednesdays!  Oh and there's a hot, friendly bartender (Daniel I think) that's usually there on quiz night. 

Answers:
1)  venhzerB dinoeL 2) ynamreG 3) ogacihC fo .vinU 4) egdelS retsiS 5) acirfA htuoS
author: Mimi L.

description:
I used to equate watching soccer in this town with places like Martin Mack's: dirty and smelly and gritty and loud.

But now I've been to Danny Coyle's. Which is a very lovely, clean bar, tended by a very polite bartender, with a cool back patio. And it still has the requisite rowdy Irish and English soccer fans gettin' their schwerves on.

I'm a proponent of dirty and smelly and gritty and loud. Really; I am. Every girl likes a bad boy like Martin. But it would be stupid not to give a nice guy like Danny a try for a hot soccer date some time...
author: Lisa T.

description:
Cal and I were an hour or two early for our dining club event, so we decided to stroll along the Haight and perhaps shop or drink. The first interesting place we saw was Danny Coyle's. What really caught my eye was the blackboard sign out front that read "Killer Bloody Mary's!" Killer - awesome. Bloody - pretty awesome. Mary - just about the best name ever! 

I've only had Bloody Mary's on long plane rides with my best friend, and those don't compare to the one served here! Dang, was it strong! I only finished about 80% of it, which I thought was pretty impressive. As for the garnishes, I didn't think the olive was that great, but the onion and green bean were really really good.

This place was cute, clean (esp. the bathroom), and pretty welcoming. I'm glad Cal and I decided to pop in. My drink and his beer came out to be 9 bucks.
author: Mary T.

description:
The website for this bar makes it seem like a club -- what with the green neon lights, people on the dance floor, and martini glass, but it was not like that at all, at least not on Wednesday nights.  Instead, it was a great, laidback Irish pub with good beers on tap and solid trivia.  Nice!

They also have some signature cocktails, which included a blackberry mojito, pineapple gimlet, pomegranate margarita, and bloody mary that night.  After succumbing to the Irish pub urge to drink Guinness, I tried their bloody mary.  It was good, but nothing out of the ordinary.  Might give some of their other cocktails a try another time.

Trivia was lively, but not too crowded (every group had seats and a table), which is key to an enjoyable experience.  There was good variety of subject matter (music, current events, sports, pop culture, history, etc.).  

They had baseball and soccer on the tvs, which was also nice.  And, like many other people here, I have to give a shout-out to their bathrooms!  Very clean, and there was a third one, which essentially turned into a 2nd women's room - awesome!  And it's in the middle of the bar, so you can still hear and participate in the trivia when you're standing in line.  There was also an ad in the bathroom for "the funniest movie ever about bulimia."  Cool beans.

P.S. The "Office Squids" will be back to dominate at trivia! :)
author: Leslie L.

description:
So I was dubious at first when Jill K. suggested this as a possible Happy Hour location. However,  I went and checked it out myself as a pre-Happy Hour recon last night and it quite handily passed muster.

I like this bar, while it isn't like my usual haunts I like it's atmosphere and the fact that front windows open up almost floor to ceiling in a fashion that reminds me of Key West...A good staff and a very nice owner (I spoke with him on the phone about drink specials for HH). I would like to see a bit more decor and bit less TV. I will hold my judgment of the jukebox until after tomorrow but I like what I heard.

Happy Hour at Danny Coyle's should be a blast...

UPDATE: Happy Hour at Danny Coyle's was everything I expected and then some - Thanks to all who made it!  This is definitely a great location (proximity to Memphis Minnies is a big plus) and I think that Brian, the owner, has a winner on his hands - Thanks for a great night Brian! 

I only have one wish and it's on the jukebox front...While the jukebox is decent it doesn't stack up to Zeitgeist or Lucky 13's...It's workable but could be better with a little more old school punk, a little more funk and a lot less Gnarls Barkley (then again I hate Gnarls Barkley so I am biased).

Great place, definitely recommend it as a place to go and toss back a pint or 3.
author: Todd E.

description:
I'm giving them 5 stars for a few reasons! Been here 3 times and liked it everytime. Twice on a Sunday and once on a Friday night. 

1. CHARGERS bar on Sundays! Unfortunately we lost both times :(
 (minus the drunk eagles fan who came in and started a fight during the game)

2. The girl who bartends there with the red hair is AWESOME! I hadn't been there in a month and she remembered what beer I drink!  That's impressive to me! She also made an effort to call the owner to see if I could get on the [FULL] guestlist for an "invite-only" Christmas party. 

3. They ended up putting myself and 4 others on the guestlist for that private party after it was supposedly full.  

4. Beer specials are great on Sunday. 

5. More that one bathroom for women! A plus when you're drinking!

6. I've met some cool people here.  

Highly recommended!
author: Courtney M.

description:
Sure, I'm not the prettiest guy in the world, but that doesn't give license to IGNORE me.

Lets paint the picture: not crowded on a Thursday night.  I walk in and see familiar looking law students meandering about.  Seeing the bar is mostly empty, I figure -- grab a beer and then to the mingling.  

SEVEN MINUTES LATER I have a beer in hand.  When the bar isn't busy, that's OBSCENE.  Repeat this once more, although to be fair, the second time around was about five minutes for a drink.

Clearly this place has an internet juke box which leads to non-staple music, which I appreciate.  However, it's WAAAY too loud.  Trying to talk in this bar is like *insert witty analogy*.

Bathrooms are SPOTLESS and HUGE.

I may give Danny Coyle's another shot simply based on the praise provided below (and likely above).
author: jack p.

description:
Clean, comfortable, and seemingly new.  It doesn't even smell of stale beer yet.  

Get it while its hot!!!
author: R M.

description:
I don't generally like sports bars, and I tend to avoid places with vaguely Irish sounding names or decoration. At least in DC, we have a lot of crappy bars that masquerade as Irish pubs, and many bad experiences have led me to roll my eyes every time someone suggests stopping in at one.

That all being said, Danny Coyle's was so much better than I would have expected. First, the bar was comfortable and not crowded, and they had an incredible bloody Mary, served in a pint glass, for $6. So spicy and delicious, and served with a pickled green bean. Eclectic crowd--several cyclists in biking spandex seated amongst people in sports gear watching the game. And people not watching the game, too. Mmm spicy bloody mary.
author: Stuart S.

description: Great place to watch sports. They always have good beer specials ($2 tecate or $3 Sam Adams).
author: M R.

description: This is one of my favorite bars in the city! Whatever you want when you go out is here - sports, great bartenders, fun people, locals, visitors, awesome jukebox, happening neighborhood are all big check marks here! I've watched election results, World Cup matches at 4 am, and UFC fights here. You just can't beat the versatility and appeal of this place!!
author: Makela C.

description:
This place is pretty alright, but it certainly doesn't wow me in any way. Definitely not a bar that I could stay at for too long - it is usually just an accessory to the other bars in the lower haight.

One highlight was an Onion pub crawl that was here - absolutely packed, but met some good people, and got a righteous onion pint glass. Yes!

I've tried to come and watch games here before, but it rarely works out very well - too many people, too much noise. Meh. Maybe I just haven't had good luck.
author: Ben Y.

description:
I was poking around on the yelp events in SF to see what was happening Saturday, and lo and behold Bryan B. is a fellow SeaHawk fan WITH an event set up to watch the game at Danny Coyle's. Hell yeah. I'm there.

After a bus ride and a walk, I arrived in Lower Haight. Seeing as I'm pretty much new to the city, it seemed to me that Lower Haight was a pretty cool little area. I walked into Danny Coyle's, which is a neat little pub with lots of room and lots of flat screens to watch multiple games. Bryan, his bro Trevor, and a few other guys were hanging out waiting for the game to start. I ordered a local SF beer, an amber that I don't remember the name of but was really tasty. Looked like DC's had a bunch of good beers on tap as well as a bunch of good stuff in bottles. 

DC's is an Irish pub; the bartenders are Irish, some of the patrons are, and I gotta say that's pretty fricken cool to find. The bathroom wasn't too shabby, and there was plenty of spots to rest your butt and drink a beer and still see a monitor.

Green Bay pounded the Seahawks, unfortunately, and there were a bunch of Packers in there. However, me, Bryan, Trevor and a fellow named Mario made sure to whoop it up when we could. I'm hoarse again, but it was well worth it.

I'd definitely recommend DC's. Looks like there's a fun group of regulars there, and it probably would be a fun time on a Fri or Sat night as well, though I don't know that for sure.
author: Will L.

description:
Danny Coyle's--great for moms!

It's the LH bar I'm most likely to bring my mother to.  I've already brought my roommate's mom here and that was a smashing success of an evening.  It has a fresh, clean interior and a nice enough staff.  They've also got enough Otis Redding and Rolling Stones to keep mother and I happy.

I have high marks for DC's because it's great at being what it is--a nice, clean establishment in an area where those are pretty rare.  Also, I enjoy watching the socc--FOOTBALL--games on the TV above the jukebox. 

I just wish nice places didn't give me the creeps.  I'd rather go to a shitty dive and feel right at home.  Too bad my mom's not a Molotov's kind of gal!
author: Eric E.

description:
Well F me. That whole Duboce Park Cafe yuppie pincer movement* on the Lower Haight was a decoy! They're really attacking us from the hills!!

Now open in the old An Bodhran location. Owned by the same folks as Martin Mack's, the space is still under development, but is shaping up to be a "nice" pub in the Lower Haight. Rather large back area with a stone floor, totally new bathrooms, flat panels on the wall... A big step up from the scuzzy neighborhood norm. By the same token, the space has no character -- yet. But we'll see what they do with it over the next few weeks (when, hopefully, I'll be raising my rating). Crowd-wise I don't know yet, but the staff is super-friendly. Keeping my fingers crossed it doesn't contribute to the 2AM "woo hoo" quotient outside by apartment much.

*See: http://www.yelp.com/biz/R3YMmqmPIjJh8V80VpTD1w?hrid=BNXgN9k3p6aY2zJMsEdtVw
author: Tom L.

description:
I finally got a chance to have a drink here after passing it repeatedly for the past several weeks. I was feeling slightly wary when I saw the marina-looking crowd, so I thought it was due time to check it out.

I must say, I was plesantly surprised. The bar staff is all extremely friendly and laid-back. I had a greyhound with the new Absolut RubyRed which was delicious and refreshing. Yes, it's a little sterile for an Irish Pub, but it just opened up... give them a break! As much as I love the grungy dives around here, it's nice to have a more upscale place in the neighborhood.

I look forward to returning!
author: Jill M.

description:
That bartender Steve is a nice bloke.  

It is now the best place to watch the Premier League in the City.  Any supporters are welcome, except Chelsea Jerry.  

It would have been 5 stars but that disturbing Spurz doll shatters the atmosphere a bit.

Edit: The doll is gone,  5 stars

BTW  It's not a Sp*rs pub right.  That's really a ridiculous concept this far away from London.  Of course it wouldn't work there but this ain't London is it.  Whether you're from Ireland or Iowa, London or Lickme we all co-exist here.  It makes the atmosphere a bit more fun I think. 

That's that!
author: Byron W.

description: I spent hours here last Saturday. Friendly bartenders. Good people watching. Good specials. TVs everywhere!!
author: Kiristen R.

description:
I know it's been mentioned in other reviews, but this has to be the most upscale-looking bar I've ever been to in the Haight, which kinda makes it stand out in it's own way...

I went here for the first time on one of Todd E's weekly installments of the 'Destroy Your Liver 2006' tour, and had a great time. The bar has a very open feel and I like the little area in the back (I didn't get to hang here though because it was too packed with Yelpers...that's what I get for arriving late). I also loved the music that was playing on the jukebox (Arcade Fire, Franz Ferdinand and the Killers among others)...good stuff!

The owner, Brian, and the staff were extremely friendly, and they have a nice selection of beers on tap...being German, the lack of Irish beers didn't disappoint me, because they have Franziskaner Hefeweizen on tap! The beers are decently priced, and I heard the prices are even better during happy hour...

Brian hooked us Yelpers up with a free round towards the end of the evening, and this was way cool because he wasn't obligated in any way to do so. It's refreshing to see business owners give a little back to their patrons for a change!

I'm sure that at some point this bar will eventually get more 'beaten down', but it's definitely worth checking out at least once, regardless of its state...
author: Art D.

description: Killer local bar. The bloody mary here is amazing - long on pepper and an interesting bitter citrus. Show up during a soccer game and get caught up in the excitement with the locals - just don't do what I did and hope to cure a hangover during a big game!
author: Brian M.

description: I come here to watch EPL games early in the morning...like 4/5:30am. Great staff, very friendly and other patrons are just as nice. Love this bar!
author: Cristina D.

description:
When I first heard that there was an Irish pub in the Lower Haight, I was a little cynical about what I would find.  I walked in here for the first time at the request of my girlfriend and was amazed! They have large televisions, great drinks and friendly bartenders.

Somehow, I managed to spend $85 dollars there last night...so...maybe the drinks aren't the cheapest in town, or maybe I just drink too much...oh well, Danny Coyle's is a great place!
author: Craig E.

description: I just found my favorite UFC bar. fuck yea
author: James R.

description:
I'm getting really, really tired of hyperbole especially since that appears to be the only way Yelpers can express themselves. Where are these bars with bathrooms that have puke & urine all over them?  I have been to many bars in this city and I have yet to find a bathroom that had puke all over it. And I don't frequent no Redwood Room. Where was this puke? Was it smothered on the walls mental hospital style? Was there a trail?  

In any case, Danny Coyle's does have an extremely clean bathroom, well sized drinks (none of those tiny glasses) a very nice happy hour with 3.50 pints and awesome huge windows to watch the neighborhood. And anyone who's ever been to the UK knows that not every single bar is a giant, cavernous dark pub. They have nice bars there, too, so there's no reason to hate on it just because it's clean.
author: Maria D.

description:
Bartender was really nice. Made good drinks. 

I think my loud friend scared her. He was REALLY loud. Its not Au Bodhran, but no place is. I like darker bars. This bar is almost sterile looking. There is no vibe or atmosphere at all. Its like a blank slate waiting to made into something. I'm a dive bar kind of girl, so as nice as it is, I don't see hanging out in there if there is no food.

I like what they did with the windows.
author: Marz W.

description:
What the hell did they do? These geniuses managed to take a 'real' looking Irish bar, An Bodhrain, and turn it into a 'faux' Irish bar. They took a place that had a great Irish dingy-ness about it and essentially turned it into a Bennigan's.

They drywalled over exposed brick and wood and replaced it with framed pictures of Ireland! 

Absolutely pathetic and sad....
author: Andrew L.

description:
I almost had to turn my back on this place b/c I received a poorly poured Guinness. I mean the shit was like a third head. And I like head but not THAT much! Especially when it comes to my Guinness. SO I had the resident Irishmen at the time fetch me another b/c they would never mess up his. The second go round I received a JEWEL! For that alone Danny Coyle's gets 5 stars. 

And 5 extra stars for playing cuts last night! I don't know who the DJ was but he was knockin!

DIsclaimer: I was later told that they hired extra folks for St. Patrick's Day which is why my pour was atrocious. Damn newbie effed up my drank!
author: Brittany D.

description:
It was the World Series. Every San Franciscan was at home or crammed into a sports bar, pub, restaurant watching the Giants play. My cousin and I were looking for a spot to watch the Sacramento Kings game. I spent an hour calling almost every sports bar in the city and was told the same thing -- "no way, not tonight, we'll be playing the Giants game on every screen". It was looking hopeless until I called Danny's. 
My fellow Yelpers, not only did the very sweet bartender on the phone agree to play the Kings game on one of their screens for the only two people in the extremely crowded pub that were going to watch it, but upon arrival, we were treated like VIP's! They reserved their cozy back lounge area with couches and a screen just for us, let us bring food in, helped us set up the game on the TV, all with cool, calm and kindness while their place was packed to the brim and ear-splittingly loud. 
I'm not a big pub/bar goer, but when I needed one most, Danny Coyles showed up 100%. Three cheers for genuine hospitality. We're going back tonight.
author: Ophir B.

description:
I enjoyed the experience at this bar immensely.  On the whole, the drinks were reasonably priced, the bartender was extremely attentive, and the place is immaculately clean.  I learned from the bartender at the bar takes its name from the owner's father, which, to me greatly adds to the charm of an already charming bar. 

What I did like about this place is the classiness of its clientele.Now, mind you, I was here in the middle of the week at night. But what I saw was an interesting cross-section of locals from all walks of life, just being really friendly.

I look forward to coming back very soon.
author: Jaime R.

description:
I stumbled upon Danny Coyle's when looking for a place for my husband, an avid Spurs fan, and I to watch his beloved Tottenham play while we vacationed in San Francisco.  We arrived in town on Tuesday, game day, and not only watched the game there, but returned later that evening AND at least once every other day we were in town.  In fact, I couldn't even tell you our hotel's address, but I can get a cabbie to Danny Coyle's!

In no apparent order, here's what I/we liked about Danny Coyle's:

*The smell!  Weird, huh?  Generally, bar reviews mention that ever presence combination frat basement and industrial cleanser smell, but both my husband and I noticed, and commented on, the subtle cedar scent present in the bar.

*The people.  This is what makes a bar, in my world, and both the patrons and the staff were super friendly and welcoming. It was an awesome place to watch Premier League games, with fans of many teams being represented.  We interacted with three different barkeeps and all were just what you want in a barkeep:  friendly, witty, attentive, and knowledgeable.  Brian, the owner, was fantastic, as well!

*TV's are appropriately placed for easy viewing, no matter where you are in the bar, w/out having a chain sports bar-esque feeling.  

*Restrooms were clean and well appointed.

*Location: lots of other great beer bars nearby, as well as tons of food options (which you can feel free to bring to Danny Coyle's to enjoy while you watch the game).

The only *slight* downside for me is the beer selection isn't my pint o' hops.  I thoroughly enjoyed Speakeasy's Big Daddy IPA while we were there, but I'm not sure what I'd have ordered if it had kicked (as you'd imagine, the beers are mostly Irish, w/a few mass produced standards and I think the only other pale was Sierra Nevada).

(Please note all of our time spent at Danny Coyle's was late morning/early afternoon.)
author: Summer K.

description:
Came here to watch a Euro Cup match. I came a little late so I was standing in the doorway. Should there have been an earthquake, I was hands down in the best spot but now my neck hurts from leaning in to watch the game. It's not dingy AT ALL as I had imagined it to be and the bathrooms are CLEAN. Even the men's! They pour Guinness well which is something I'd automatically expect from an Irish pub. There's a nice little area in the back with couches and such which I discovered after the game. 

They're dog friendly which is good for my friend's dog that enjoys licking the spilled beer off tables. 

It's nothing spectacular but the atmosphere was fun because everyone was really into the game. I have no idea what it's like on a regular day or at night even since the games are at noon.
author: Janelle B.

description:
I like to call this place Danny O'Danny's.  Why, because it's funny.

As for the bar, it's a good place to drink.  One of the owners is Brian from Martin Mack's.  If that doesn't mean anything to you, well, Brian is a great barman.  He makes people comfortable, serves great drinks, and occasionally drops a freebee on the barflys.  
The place has been extensively remodeled, which isn't necessarily a bad thing.  Those purists that liked the old place can find a new shithole I suppose.  
Danny Coyle's is a clean well lighted place to drink.  Don't go there, cause I want a seat at the bar when I get there.
author: Nelson W.

description: If you're a bay area Charger fan like myself this is the place to be to watch the games and hang with fellow Charger lovers!
author: Rochelle I.

description:
Chapel Hill ex-pats:
They serve Miller Light in He's Not Here bazillion ounce blue cups. 
And they will cheer as the Heels trounce Dook.
Enough said.
author: Chava K.

description:
So, I would expect Irish Pub + Lower Haight = divey (especially if they do Pub Quiz).  Surprisingly, though, Danny Coyle's is quite bright and polished inside, though the bartender is so authentic he might make you think you're in the village pub somewhere in the Irish countryside.

As for Pub Quiz itself:  when I say the British MC is better, I mean it!  The British guy has charisma and runs the quiz like clockwork, whereas the guy at Danny Coyle's got started late and was reaaaaaal slow, so it wound up dragging on till 11:30.  Plus, he was a bit boring, perhaps the reason why this was definitely the least crowded pub quiz I've been to yet.  Lots of teams dropping out early or starting late.  And yet we still only got second place.  Damn!

Overall: good pub, but not the best pub quiz.
author: Wes M.

description: When I first moved out here to San Francisco, or America in general, I thought I would have to give up watching the EPL games, the Champions League games, the FA Cup games etc. Not until a friend of mine told me about Danny Coyle's. It truly is a great bar. Great atmosphere, lots of televisions mounted and a big projector screen. The place overall is very clean, probably the cleanest bar I have been in. Bartenders are awesome and always friendly. Long live Danny Coyle's!
author: Jon A.

description:
UPDATE:  8.22.06  Have been back a couple times.  DC's has the cleanest bathrooms which is nice.  Jukebox could use some work but that will happen.  They make a great margarita and that's important!

I was not at the Yelp happy hour however, I just went over to DC's to meet a friend for a little bit.  Actually, I didn't even drink a beer.  I just sat at the end of the bar looking at my cute friend, catching up, and being completely content.  

I could for sure go back to Danny Coyles and waste an afternoon.  The owner actually stopped to chat and was very nice.  Yeah, this bar is a bit clean for a pub but give it another World Cup season and the place will be beat up just right or actually, maybe a few more yelp happy hours?!

Rock on DC's!
author: James M.

description:
Great little bar with an awesome selection of drinks. Don't really remember much from my visit as it was the third stop on a tour de bars with my friends, but 

Friday night: good crowd, fun music, cute girls
Monday: Trivia, cheep beer, we got 3rd place.

I'd return for sure.
author: Adam L.

description:
After being very excited to finally find a Chargers bar in San Francisco for the playoffs, I made my way to the bar at the start f the game. There was wall to wall people, almost unable to move, but OK, it's playoffs, I expected that.  And they played the "San Diego SuperChargers" song!! After muscling my way to the bar, I stole a bar seat where there were 3 bartenders for the whole bar. The service was quite prompt for how busy it was, I didn't wait long for a decently priced drink at all. Despite the large crowd, there was never a line for the bathroom. 

The only reason I am giving 4 stars and not 5 is there was one bartender who was very obnoxious. He was wearing a Radiers t-shirt and talking lots of smack to all the patrons there. I understand that he may be a Raiders fan, and dislike the Chargers, but you work at a CHARGERS BAR!! My only regret was giving this douche bag a big tip before I heard him run his mouth. This guy alone would make me not want to go there again. He sat down every 5 minutes to eat, leaving only 2 bartenders busting their ass, while being rude the whole time. For this reason alone, I would avoid this bar, or at least that employee. It was appalling.

Other than that one person, the experience there was good. Good crowd, fast drinks, and Chargers fans!!
author: krista z.

description:
Buy out the An Bohdran, chase out the sessions, do your level best to Americanize a product that really did not need changing and double your beer prices.

A suggestion to make some more money- have a little table where patrons can take out a second mortgage to make the bar tab.

Oh, they do have clean bathrooms.  Very, very, very clean bathrooms.
author: Cheezy P.

description:
Yeah 5 Star, and why are there so many damn Elite 08 people coming hear and shi-shi-ing on this place.  Poo on you

Okay, I'll give you some people here can be total wankers, like the ass who decided to push his stool backwards  (while he mumbled in drunk talk about me being to close to him)  not allowing me to get near the bar to order my drink.  Hey fuck face go smoke another cigarette so I can get my drink.

Trivia night, awesome....until that damn competition started, who knew there was so many damn Jeopardy champs in this town, go away and solve world hunger, or the green issues....let the dumb people play again.  98% of the population has an IQ under 130, let them have there fun.

And to the Bar Tender that keeps carding me, learn you damn locals, I have been coming here over a year, every damn Thursday, and I know you don't work often but damn, really, a whole year and you still think that I am under 21 this whole time.  I even point out this fact to you every time you card me.

But why 5 you ask at this point because I am pointing out all the bad.  Brian(owner) sponsors soccer teams, he hosts great events, especially for Football(yes Soccer).  And last St. Patty's Day my best friend and I fixed there electrical problems with 150 people drinking in there, this kind of heroism leads to free drinks.  As does tipping the wonderful Bartender.  Being nice gets you nice things.  Remember this.
Also, one of the guys that worked there recognized our BYOBW symbol.  Kudo's to the hip and Knowledgeable staff.

I think everyone would give more 5 stars if they were 5 star customers. bitches.

Now for the recent reviews:
-Andy F. don't dock stars because of your inability and lack of social skills at a sports bar, your problem not theirs.  You lose two stars.
-Christopher S.  thank you for acknowledging that places have off nights, I recommend you go again, not on a weekend, and enjoy the place.  Come during a Football game(soccer game) and enjoy this place for what it really has to offer.  You will find yourself into the games even if you don't know who is what is going on.

-Alissa d.  thank you for wasting time and stars, reserve them for real reviews with actual stories.

-Jaime L, bewbz does not always = free drinks, however, I may reconsider this if you stumble in on Thursday night when our soccer team is there.  I will have a tab running.  But lay off people who might be training, and leave the PMS in the bathroom.
author: Jonathan K.

description:
Although not officially a Chargers bar, it appears that all of the San Diegans currently in the Bay have an understanding to congregate here.

A lot of great energy for games if you're a fan. If you're not into football, and I mean AT ALL, don't come here during game time. It gets crazy packed and crazy hot. During halftime, I couldn't stop thinking about how I would like to take a nice shower.
author: Joel J.

description: Absolutely hands down the best place I've been (in sf) to have a beer! Brian was very friendly as was all his staff who served us throughout our many stops here this week.  English premier league games on, as well as real deal supporters enjoying the games. Only downfall was no food, but as others have reported there are some good spots nearby to grab a bite to eat and bring it into the bar. COYS!!!!
author: Cory K.

description:
Wow, how did I forget to write about this place after my very first Yelp event?

There's nothing to dislike about Danny Coyle's.  It's a beautiful bar, with a lot of friendly faces, great service, nearby restaurants for involuntary food timeouts, and a solid happy hour.

The "upper level" (a whole two steps up) provides a great area for larger groups to socialize and relax.  If I could assign any more stars for the comfortable seating, I would.

Danny Coyle's makes me want to move to Lower Haight.  I don't care if it's just an easy trip on the 22 from where I live, that's not good enough damnit!
author: Adam W.

description:
I love a good jack and coke
They make the most delicious jack and cokes!!
Great place to sit and talk with friends
Nice atmosphere (candles and mood lighting)
The best thing about Danny Coyle's is that it's CLEAN!!!  I am not afraid to go into their bathroom for fear of no toilet paper or puke on the floor.  I give a star just for having soap!
author: Jordan D.

description:
Super hetero place. Some douchey guys watching the NCAA game (this was back in March). We came here for Trivia Night, and it was our first and last times here. He quiz master was super annoying and the grunting basketball fans got on everyone's nerves.

Bartender was nice though. He brought out a dusty bottle of Patron XO (he didn't even know they had it until we asked him about it), gave us some free shots (since we were the first ones ever to order it). So that made up for it. Hard to find a table also. Grunt Grunt.
author: Rocky K.

description:
Update:  Just had a party there a couple weekends ago.  They really took care of us & everyone had a blast!

It's like your favorite neighborhood bar in location newly remodeled & clean!
author: laura g.

description:
Recently opened (remodled), the bar is clean and crisp -- especially their marbled spacious bathrooms.  The place is very presentable with an inviting attitude that lets you bring your coworkers (not just your Irish friends) along for a drink or seven. There's plenty of space to sit and stand, whether it's at the bar, at the tables that line the floor, near the jukebox or in the back area.  Luckily, Danny Coyle's also happens to be one of the few bars in the Haight that serve hard-hitting liquor -- and in good sized glasses with good prices.  Yay.

All in all, I really enjoy the ambiance and the senior bartender to want to come here again and again and not have to apologize for my choice in drinking establishments.
author: Vicky B.

description: My favorite bar in the area. They have nice TVs and show every sporting event imaginable. Every time I've been I've made friends with someone. The drinks are drinks and made as well as you would expect. There usually have pretty nice drink specials too. Bartenders are all really cool as well, which is nice. They also show all of the UFC events for $10, which isn't bad, considering most places charge double. Also, like everyone else has said...nice bathrooms.
author: Alex R.

description: I don't know where you'd go to around the Haight, in a pinch, to watch big-time sports events (at least the ones important to me). This is an Irish-style pub where you'd expect heavy-metal motif should be-- but that's the Haight. The drink prices are a little stiff and pricing for big-event nights will vary. I saw a Pacquiao fight here about a year ago, and it was $20 per person, but they did cram us in despite what the fire marshall might say. There are two big screen TVs at the back of the bar and there are plenty of friendly locals and tourists there to enjoy your Guinness with.
author: Reyz A.

description: After going to to the Giants- A's game with my older brother. I really wanted to go to north beach bars  but my brother said Haight bars were good. We went here a lot of hot brunette chicks! i was shocked for Haight street bars. I thought it would be all weird hippies lol
author: Brian B.

description: There are plenty of Irish bars in San Francisco, and this one's a bit off my usual path. The place has the right feel - dark and has Guiness. There were quite a few knots of people (I'm assuming each group consisted of friends, but one can never tell) around each table. My alumni group held a place in the back, and we had a good time until we got hungry. Coyle's does not serve food, but allows food to be brought in; the size of the group, however, militated against .ease of sharing, so we headed to Axum Cafe up the street.
author: Marcus M.

description:
I used to come here all the time to watch football.  Then I had enough.  It is stupid to have one girl working on a Sunday when you have that big of a crowd for football.

Really, one bartender and a buser. Get it together, get some food and change up the seating. Oh and don't let so many Cowboys fans in, they get loud and lippy.  It's just asking for a riot to break out.
author: Jackson D.

description:
Mellow joint and unlike many of the other bars in the neighborhood has a full liquor license.  Was with some friends who wanted scotch and we hit several bars that only had beer before finally finding the promised land - Danny Coyle's.

Cool bartender.  They have a digital jukebox.  People were dancing, including us.  Overall quite chill, not a scene.  Seems like a neighborhood kinda place.
author: Aaron T.

description: This is by far one of my favorite bars in the city. It is super chill and they have Carlsberg on tap which is what keeps me coming back time after time.  The bartenders are super friendly and attentive. My boyfriend and I love coming here to grab a beer after work. The weekends are fun as well but what I love most is that no matter how busy they are, you can always find a place to sit or a table to stand around with your friends. They also have this comedy night which is pretty cool and you can bring in your pizza from down the street or your dog.  :)
author: Monica M.

description:
What is so appealing about a sterile Irish pub? Sure, it's clean but where is the authenticity? Slapping an Irish name on an otherwise generic space in which to consume alcohol (hotel lobby, perhaps?) does not an Irish pub make. 

I just moved into the lower Haight neighborhood so I thought I'd check out the local bar, stumbled in at the tail end of trivia night - wow, those are some tough questions. I didn't care too much for the overall scene. 

One star for the jukebox. 

One star for $2.50 Miller Lite that, for some reason, tasted like french fries to me that night.
author: Angela N.

description:
I have mixed feelings about Danny Coyle's.  I love their pub quiz night--the crowd is usually pretty cool on Wednesdays.  Other days of the week?  Not so much.  

The staff varies from great to downright incompetent and snooty to freakin' awesome.

So while I'll continue the pub quiz, you won't find me coming back on any other nights.
author: Jen D.

description:
Here's something great about Danny Coyle's:  They keep their obligatory, framed photos of the "old country" way in the back, upstairs, further afield than the bathrooms.  

It's about as pleasant and unpretentious a place as you'd want to drink in.  Decent mixed drinks, a few beers on tap, friendly bartenders, and a huge, cuddly dog that plonks down in the least convenient spot on the floor. They have a jukebox which I still haven't figured out.   When you're tired of getting sneered at by the Toronado's beer wench (she's a review waiting to be written), out of cash from Mad Dog in the Fog, and don't have the energy for Molotov's, Danny Coyle's is the place for you.  What's not to like?         This isn't the best bar in the city by a long shot, but a reliable neighborhood standby.
author: Phil K.

description:
This place definitely deserves bonus points for the free round for the Yelp crew, but an Irish Pub needs to serve more Irish beer (no Guinness or Murphy's :-O) and it should smell musty and stale, it should be dark, with lots of cheesy paintings, pictures of people from years past, and mirrors with beer logos on them.

Positives: area in the back is great for lounging with a large group, happy hour pints are $3.50, the bartenders really are as cool as everyone says, the bathrooms are clean and can fit more than one person (definitely an improvement over the traditional Irish Pub, I'm not a complete purist).

Bottom line: give it time to accumulate some grime and it will feel just fine.
author: David V.

description:
Went here for the first time yesterday.

Danny Coyle's feels amazingly out of place in the Haight, but it's a nice bar...almost too nice (cue "The Who" music)

Seriously, this place is very clean, warm and cozy.  It's a nice little bar, like Martin Mack's better-looking younger sister - the one that gets really good grades, looks great, but probably won't sleep with you.

I tried, but I couldn't hate it.
author: Adam B.

description: Fun bar with decent drinks specials. Only advice is that the crowd is very into sports and may get a bit intense with the cheering. But if they are rooting for your favorite team then by all means it is definitely the place to be!
author: Jose B.

description:
Danny Coyle's is usually the place I go when I'm in the lower Haight and want to relax with some friends and a beer or two.  Toronado's is always too crowded, and the Mad Dog in the Fog is too scummy.  I'll stop in for bar trivia from time to time, and my wife was nearly stabbed by a homeless lady right outside.  She quickly made her way into Coyle's to ease her stress with a pint.

However, we walked in last Friday and the whole bar turned to look at us - not in an LA-is-it-a-star-kind of way, but in a what-the-f-are-you-doing-here kind of way.  People at the bar stared, pointed, acted like asses.  Including the people behind the bar.  

We're not hipsters, yuppies, fancy-pantses, or, in fact, young.  After living in Boston for 6 years, we generally just like Irish bars.  And, usually, we like this one.

Message - don't come here on a Friday unless you already come here on a Friday.
author: Pete G.

description: Came here with a friend to watch the Chargers play... Good crowd, quick service at the bar, and decent price on beer. Gets crowded but an open back door gives the room a nice breeze. Nice bathrooms, and didn't take too long to find close parking. Yay for Dannys!
author: Cori C.

description:
The other reviewers are right - the bathrooms are really amazing! But, that's not the only thing to say about this bar. It's a super chill place to hang out on the weekends in the afternoon. They make good drinks, let you bring in food, and the people are cool. Plus, Danny Coyle is a sponsor for my soccer team - so they're awesome for that!

They let me bring in my dog (there are often other dogs there, too), which is cool. Although, at some point in the evening they turn up the music - Charlie doesn't like that very much.
author: Amanda S.

description:
I've spent many a night here getting trashed.  There's nothing really special about this bar, however, except for the fact that it's close to my house.  No pool tables, beer is on the expensive side, and not particularly comfortable seating.  There is a back patio that they don't let you use.  There are TV's that will usually have some sporting event on, although American sports are often preempted for soccer.  They do have friendly bartenders.  They do serve liquor though, which is a plus.

Also, as many before me have noted, their bathrooms are always pristine and the door can be locked behind you, should you be doing something that necessitates a locked door. . . 

I miss An Bodhran.  They had a dart board.
author: matt c.

description: As my neighborhood bar, Danny Coyle's certainly fits the bill for comfort, style and great drinks. They have Carlsberg on tap (+), great service and always have a game on. I have sat in on their trivia nights which are fun also!
author: Alissa C.

description:
I want to like this bar because it's in my immediate hood, but I pretty much don't. 
The have a sign out front that says "killer bloody marys". Their bloody marys are really terrible. Go to Zeigeist for a real bloody, yoho. 
The only thing Irish about it is the name. 
No atmosphere, no character, nothing. Booo.
author: Mort B.

description:
I came here once, early on a weeknight, when they were doing trivia and cheap margaritas, and left feeling pretty positive. Seemed like a chill, laid-back neighborhood pub type of place.

Then this weekend I went late on a Saturday night and the place had morphed into some weird club with lights and booty-shaking stupid music. 

Not sure yet what to make of this spot. I like my Irish pubs consistently relaxed, with a buy two get one free policy.
author: Melissa J.

description:
Nice place to get a beer in the lower Haight.  As a rule, I prefer my pubs a little darker and grittier with dim lighting (resisting...urge...to....compare....to...An Bodhran....), but the bartenders are kind and the big windows in front allow a nice refreshing breeze to waft in.  

I was served a well-poured Black & Tan, which passes the pub test for me, and only $4 at Happy Hour, which passes the drinking funds test for me.

I could NOT remember the name of this place so all day I was calling it "Rusty Spoon" in my mind, which I am now trademarking ("Rusty Spoon" tm Liz S.) as the name of the darker, grittier bar that I may open one day.  Yar.

Meanwhile, if you are looking for a clean, decent place to have a beer or margarita on a lazy day or after work, check out Danny Coyle's for its friendly atmosphere and reasonable prices.

Thanks, megan j., for the introduction, and to you other fine Yelpers, cheers & hope to see you there again soon.
author: Liz S.

description: Spacious Irish sports bar on East Haight, everyone is very friendly and beers for a good price.
author: Alex R.

description:
After hitting Duboce Park Cafe for lunch I headed here with Bunny for what we call Mojito Monday Madness. The place wasn't quite packed yet and we had the pleasure of sitting in the backyard drinking a cider (me) and a Mojito (Bunny) enjoying the afternoon sun. The bartender was quite friendly and invited us back for their 1yr anniversary which is this coming Saturday. Overall price for drinks was reasonable and the patrons were friendly and even offered to share their sampling of pomegranate margaritas. Needless to say after 2 ciders for me and 2 Mojitos for Bunny we headed to Nickie's for a bite.  

Great service with friendly staff and patrons makes for one good afternoon of camping out in the Lower Haight (See Bunny is a ture Lowerhaighter...and am just an impostor from SOMA).
author: Teddy d.

description:
DC's is effin sweet.  Good deals on drinks, TVs everywhere and good parties.  Plus they host the Baracus Rugby Team!
and the bartender (Tanya on Thursdays) is great
author: Spencer P.

description: What do you expect, It's a Irish sports bar. Good TVs and at least they have pitchers and a few beer specials on trivia night ;)
author: Minh V.

description: Went here on St. Pattys and it was super packed at 6pm, which is by no means surprising. However, it took way too long to get a drink, I quite possibly waited over 20 minutes to get 1Guiness! It was also super hot inside, which is also something I've noticed every time I come here. So why do I keep coming back? It's simple, easy to get to, and chill. On a normal night, it's a good place for conversation, however like I said wearing less clothing is preferable since it gets so hot.
author: Sonya D.

description: If you're looking for a great place to watch a soccer game, this is your place. They open very early for games on the weekends. Good beer, great crowd and you can bring food in with you! Good times!
author: Michael H.

description: Came here for trivia night last Wednesday after the Giants parade. I had a really nice time here. They have lots of TV's for watching various games. The bartenders were friendly. Only thing was their beer selection was okay...only one IPA? I guess it's hard to be across the street from Tornado.
author: Erin S.

description:
When I first moved into the lower haight I was stoked to be so close to Rosamunde, Toronado, Thep Phenom, Cafe Soliel, et al.  An Bodhran was included in the high stoked factor.  When seeing it close I was very dubious indeed of the new development.

Side note:  Funny that I see bar availability as an amenity to a neighborhood.  I'd be a horrible realtor.

Well, after a trip to Martin Macks on some hazy night that left me without my favorite jacket, of which I had to retrieve the next day, I got to speaking to the bartender, while partaking in the hair of the dog, I learned about the plan of DC.  I'd give it a shot...they returned my jacket.  Well, that and I can see it from my window making it definitly stumble distance from my bed...or any other flat surface in my house.  So, in other words...I was going to check it out anyway but the jacket return made me feel like a trip was deserved.

Interior:  Not as charming as the old place but damn clean and accessable.  This is so nice when meeting a group of friends.  The bathroom is always nice.  The bar is always clean.  The lighting is OK and the TVs are doable as well.  I know that DC wants to rival Mad Dog a little re football games so I understand...plus I love sports so no real complaints.

They take CCs.

Staff:  Brian is top notch.  My girl can vouch for the other bartenders as well.  They are all very friendly and make it a point to get to know their customers.  Again, another shoutout to Brian.  He pours himself into DC and you can tell.  There has never been a time when he hasn't made me feel like and old friend returnng back to the bar.  

I agree w/ a comment earlier about gentrification.  As a Planner myself I know the pitfalls of certain redevelopment and resettlement patterns but when done right, also allowing for market forces, a mutually beneficial path will emerge.  DC is an example.  Yes the lower haight has a steeped history of being passed over for more trendy neighborhoods...thank god for that.  However, if things never change it leads to stagnant neighborhoods.  A measured amount of new blood and new approaches can retain old values but add vigor to accomplish the overall goal.  I am glad to see DC do well.  To those that don't go because they want to keep lower haight the way it used to be are missing out.  DC will be around for awhile and I'd like to welcome Brian and crew to the lower haight...and by the looks of things (i.e. business) you guys are doing very well.

Cheers
author: Chris D.

description: I head here after a long night at work to have a quick drink at the bar. The bartender Brian is perfect with his service. I always find a seat, and the noise and crowd are never too obnoxious. I can actually have a real conversation with my friends and not have to shout over anyone. This bar is super refreshing for me, as there are WAY too many drunken 21 year old hipsters in front of all the other local bars to keep me coming here.
author: Jena D.

description:
Pretty typical Irish pub.  They pour a good Guinness, they've got a good selection of whiskey.  They're apparently known for blackberry mojitos, which strikes me as odd given that it's an Irish pub, but I didn't try them so couldn't tell you how they are.  There are a lot of TVs, so sometimes it can feel more like a sports bar than a pub.  They're dog-friendly, which is fun.  There's also a fairly secluded space in back with some bench/couch things that's above and away from the noisy floor of the bar which is nice if you've got a small-ish group and want some space to chill.

Basically, there's nothing to particularly recommend it, but nothing to particularly recommend against it either.
author: Don H.

description:
Oh Nish--I felt bad about signing onto Yelp and giving this place 3 stars...then I saw your review and agreed completely with your 3 stars and your assessment.  Thank god for Nish.  
This totally isn't a bad bar.  It's even better than decent.  But for some reason it just can't jump above 3 for me.  Why?  Read Nish's review.  He's right on.  And I miss An Bodhran too.
author: Blake W.

description:
I really must stop drinking on Mondays!  I came here on Monday with a friend and had a great time just hanging out and talking.  Granted, since it was Monday, the place was empty.  But I really liked the venue! As others have written, it was really nice and clean!  I liked how there were a bunch of TVs with sports games on. 

I'm not sure how this place is when it's poppin, but I'd definitely come back to check it out then.
author: James C.

description:
I heart this bar. They let me bring my dog, Molly. 
I will be back, OFTEN!!!
author: Erin A.

description: This is kind of our go-to place for trivia.  The MC is fun (his music round is hard as hell though), the drinks are reasonable, and they allow outside food (hello sausages/bbq/ethiopian food).  I don't know when or if they still do this, but a few times we came early...around 7pm or so, and they gave out free chips + salsa.  Just, you know, something to think about.
author: jon y.

description:
Yep, the specter of a clean bar in the lower Haight is something to behold. In fact, that's the reason I went there. Sometimes you just don't want the energy sucked out of you.

I had heard that their bloody marys were good. Not so. I asked for extra horseradish, thinking that was the most polite way of getting more bang for my buck, but it did little.

They were advertising their hot toddies. Perhaps those are better. Or other drinks.

Rugby was on the television and there was a healthy population of Irish lads there. And there were dogs present, which I consider a near panacea for anything bad in a bar.

Danny, I'll give you another try to find your greatness.
author: Blake E.

description:
When the DC first opened, it quickly became my regular local, specifically because of the great Magners on tap, and the low key, chill atmosphere it provided. The fact that is is right across the street from my house didn't hurt either.
But as time was waning, I came to find all these marina-esque-wanna-be-urbanites coming into the neighborhood and bringing with them lousy music that pulses into the wee morning hours, as the drunk said wannabes walk up the hill to divis, gaggleing all the way,  to catch a cab back to their own hood. 
Other than that, Steven is the best bartender in the world! I do like going on Sunday-Wed nights when it is not so busy you can get thru the door and the hip hop, bass thumpin music has been turned down a few notches.  Locals stay away on weekends....
Bring back the Magners on Draft!!!
author: Sara A.

description:
I've been coming here to play trivia recently and it's actually a pretty nice looking bar.  They  must of did a remodel recently because really has that look. If you're into bars with that real divey feel, then don't come here.  The bathrooms are ridiculously clean unlike 98% of all other bars.  It's so clean, I wouldn't feel so bad if I had to drop a yule log here.

Anyways, the bartenders are usually pretty quick and the drink prices are about average.  I can only comment on trivia night (wed) but it gets pretty packed and sometimes we have a hard time finding a seat.  Anyways, I guess it doesn't matter when you win first place hahaha.  Ok we don't win first place every week but I think we do ok.

Parking around here isn't the best but I tend to be able to find something in a reasonable time frame. (5-10 min of circling).  That's one of the negatives of the location.

I can't comment on the place on the weekend because I never come here on the weekend so come here and let me know how it goes.
author: Jason Y.

description:
The area is a little scary, but trivia nights are pretty fun.  That is....even if i don't know any of the answers!  I guess all the regulars here are pretty smart, that, or they study their butts off for wednesday nights to compete at a bar.  

Really chill environment and mgd for 2.50!  I would like to go back or try other places for these trivia nights with a bunch of friends.  there's a great burrito place down the street, but I don't recommend walking alone at night.  
-j
author: Janice's A.

description:
After stuffing my face at a barbecue restaurant down the street, my friend and I find ourselves basking in the sun on Haight, and as we walk past Danny Coyle's we see a few girls hanging on the windowsill like cats. We stop in for a pint.

If you're going to drink during the day, this is the place to do it. Irish accents everywhere, spitting drunk friendly rantings from the locals on any subject ranging from the sad state of Ireland's representation in the Olympics to the best bar snack on the planet. Don't bother the bartender with your girlie cocktail drinks, it's annoying to her and the rest of us who just want another round of pints for the crew. This is a bare-bones Irish bar in San Francisco, and it will be remembered. If only it had a pool table.

The girls were very entertaining and within a few hours we all stumbled off together to begin the evening's activities, which thanks to our stint at Danny Coyle's will not be recorded in the Yelp chronicles as they are not easily recovered from memory.
author: Ben W.

description: I knew this was my kind of place when I bellied up to the bar only to find a dog on the bar stool!
