I couldn't believe it when we stopped by on a nice afternoon (drawn by the the fact that they open the front windows to the street) and the bartenders let me bring my sweet (but not always perfectly behaved) yellow lab Motley in the bar with me.  We had a few beers, enjoyed the great weather, and watched the street traffic mozy by on Haight.  Anyplace my boyfriend, our dog, and I can all go grab a beer together gets my stamp of approval!
author: Meagan C.

description:
Danny Coyles is a simple sports bar but it does what it does very very well.  Great place to watch a game (flat screen tvs all over the place) or just get drinks with friends.  They'll also let you bring food in from surrouning establishments which is always a plus.

I would definitely recommend DC as a place to watch a game or just to get drinks (Bloody Mary is pretty good).  One reviewer sad 'bar most likely to take my mother to' and I completely agree!  I mean this in the best way possible - my mother's a cool chick.
author: Katie M.

description: Went here on Weds night for Trivia, got stuck next to a trio of loud mouth drunks doing shots, which is no biggie, but when they let there dog drink from a glass of water at the bar right in front of the bar tender, then thats not cool. The place had about six other dogs inside,  two that were large breeds, one of which was let off lease to wander the bar, sniff crotches and be a nuisance to other patrons. This is just a new level of ridiculousness with people and their pooches. My wife just did not appreciate being sniffed up and come on to by yet another dirty dog.
author: Bill K.

description:
I am giving 4 stars for having big open windows that let all the awesome sunshine and fresh air in.  It helps me feel less guilty about drinking indoors on a beautiful day.  I'm holding off on the 5th star becuase I havent tasted any of their mixed drinks, just beer...

Seriously though, I am sorta ok with global warming if it causes this beautiful weather.

Did I mention I like the weather lately? And drinking when the weather is beautiful?
author: b s.

description:
Danny Coyles is one of the best bars in the city, period. A great mix of people, probably 50% Irish, and the others locals in the neighborhood. Also several dogs were there the few times I went in, so bring your dog for a walk in Duboce park, work up a thirst, and then stop by DC's afterwards. 
Brian the bartender and owner is one of the best in the business. Consumate pro, and all round nice guy...
author: Dave O.

description:
This place has gone through a lot of iterations in the years, with my favorite name: Don's Different Ducks.

But now, as Danny Coyle's still Irish, since the previous incarnation, the bar was rebuilt to an incredibly day-friendly place to sit and sip on bloody marys, beer, whiskey, what have you.  It is easily one of the most pleasant places to spend the early part of a Sunday afternoon with its open window front. And the owner is an extraordinarily nice guy, who takes great pride in his establishment.

I've not been in here at night yet, but it's high on my list of places to drink in the daytime.
author: Kennelco C.

description: This is such a cool and fun bar that my friends and I tabbed Danny Coyle's as "Danny Goodtimes". I love this place. It is clean, people are friendly, the bartenders and very nice and professional, and the flat screen tv's are awesome. They have NBA League Pass, Euro football, American football, you name it, they got it. I love this place even more because everytime I am in there the bartender always gets a drink for me and my crew (oh, your tip is rising, sweetie!!).  I don't know what you would call this: An Irish Pub, a sports bar, local joint, weekend scene? It kind of is all these into one. For a quasi sports bar to have a decent number of good looking women and for them to have a solid female to male ratio is an extra plus. I love this place.
author: Nick H.

description: Solid place. Good sports spot, particularly international sports.  I'll certainly be here for the World Cup next summer, as the many ex-pats here (I know, actual Irishmen in an Irish bar!) will add a nice fanatical edge to things.  Drinks are pretty reasonable, and they let me watch the Red Sox here pretty much whenever I want.  Hard for this transplanted New Englander to complain after that.
author: Brian M.

description: A sports bar with very good bloody mary's. Open space and not too cramped.
author: Brandon D.

description: I've changed my mind about this bar.  Stopped in for a few pints last night and had a pretty good time.  Bartender was great, beer was cold, and the crowd was chill.  The jukebox selection was a little too pop for my taste, but I'd be more than happy to swing by again soon for another pint.
author: Joshua W.

description: Danny Coyle's defines what a great neighborhood bar should be. It is authentically Irish, with a professionally but completely down to earth staff, and a hilarious litany of regulars. I can think of few places I would rather watch the Giants game. There are plenty of TVs and the sight lines are great. On the weeknights the bar is often busy, but rarely crowded so you'll be able to watch the game and be amused by some surprisingly drunk/friendly Irish fellow just off work with the moving company. Recognize that you're in for a much more crazy viewing experience if you try to attend any major European football matches (or even NFL football when it can get quite crowded,) but for baseball or a quick pint on the Haight, DCs is always my first choice.
author: David N.

description: This place might yet become cool, but right now, it just isn't yet.  First of all the drinks are too expensive for the neighborhood - if I want to pay $5 for a pint of beer, I'll drink downtown.  Second, it can't seem to decide whether it wants to be a chill lounge (ala Amber) or an upscale sports bar, and as a result, is unsatisfying as either.  I was there recently at happy hour, and thought that if they had been playing Marilyn Monroe movies (or whatever) instead of ESPN news on the big LCD tvs, the vibe would've been much nicer.  It's brand new, though, so maybe they'll get their act together still.
author: Joe C.

description:
now i love dive bars as much as the next person, but damn it, toronado bartenders, you better be nice to me next time or i'll take my rosamunde sausage and my business over to the nice bartenders at danny coyle's. damn! this bar is really clean and it's in lower haight. an oxymoron? i think not. obviously, the gentrification of lower haight is further along than i thought. yeah, you can preach me about the downside of the gentrification. blah, blah, blah... however, sometimes all i want is good beer, a squeaky clean space that doesn't smell like barf and squeaky clean bathrooms without bodily fluids all over the floor. as matter of fact, the bathrooms at danny coyle's are so damn clean that i might even bring my girlfriend and have sex. how's that for an endorsement? 

* ok, the sex part was to emphasize how clean the bathrooms were.
author: frisco j.

description: Trivia nights are great, I've never noticed any douchey guys there, and the bartenders are always fast, professional, and nice - plus, they know how to pour a drink without skimping on the liquor! Not too pricey, and very comfortable. Plus, this is on one of the quieter blocks in the lower haight - the next block down (Molotovs, etc.) gets sketchy and loud.
author: Dustin D.

description: It's a solid Irish Pub. Not cheap, not overpriced and has a great atmosphere. Great place to watch football (or football).  The bartenders are nice and the service is good. I was here for trivia night on a Wednesday and it got so hot in there I had to leave. I know usually places have to worry about staying warm, but open a window or something. Alcohol plus heat just makes for an ornery crowd.
author: Corey V.

description: The place has no character whatsoever.  It's not a bad bar, but there is absolutely nothing that makes it superior to any other bar in any conceivable way.
author: Quinn S.

description:
I miss An Bodhran.  It was dark and pubby with low ceilings, and dark wood, and dark light and also it was pubby.
In its place is Danny Coyle's.  A generic "pub" where the only thing pubby about it is the sexy accent on the bartender and the selection of beer & whisky.  The remodel is very updated, clean & fresh.  Sitting up front by the big foldy windows on a nice day is lovely.  It was pretty empty when we were there so we had our pick of seats.
But it's about as "Irish pub" as I am Mexican.  Which you know, I am, but not much.
I'm picking on poor Danny Coyle, and maybe I'll have a change of heart once I'm fully over the loss of An Bodhran (which I went to ONCE mind you, but loved immediately and intensely) and this new "upscaling" of the scungy lower Haight; but on a foggy San Francisco summer day, I want a close, cozy, dark spot to sip my Bass.  Also?  The plaster needs fixing - man that's a pet peeve of mine.
author: Jennifer D.

description: If you are a legit soccer fan, like legit enough that you call it football, then this place is for you. I was recently there for the Tottenham/Arsenal game. There were at least 20 fans watching the game split 50/50 for both teams. When Tottenham scored the final goal in injury time to tie the game, the spurs fans errupted. Running around, hugging, jumping, knocking over drinks, mocking arsenal fans, although I was gutted from giving away the two points it was awesome to sit through something that felt like a real english soccer experience. Drinks are a bit steep though if you like the imports, but what do you expect? it's SF
author: Ian S.

description: Solid, all-around bar. It's especially great being a New England Patriots fan out here and knowing that I can watch my team every Sunday no matter who they're playing. Very clean, nice bartenders, good selection of drinks. It's not really amazing in any facet and nothing wows you about it, but still a great place to go.
author: Mark A.

description: Danny Coyle's is a reliable neighborhood Irish bar where you can watch sports without an overwhelming crowd of people. $2 Miller Light bottles on Sundays during (American) football season do the trick. They don't serve food, but they invite you to bring your own in. The nearby take-out options like Burger Joint and Rosamunde make that a great idea.
author: Seth B.

description: I am a hockey fanatic.  I would LOVE to go out to watch the games more, but during playoff time I can't risk showing up at a bar that has the game on one tiny TV, sandwiched between two baseball games with no sound.  Well, I was in the neighborhood with my bf about to head home for the Habs/ Caps game when I decided to stop in.  The game was showing on one TV, no sound, just like I thought...but wait.. the bartender said he would be happy to turn the game on the huge , private TV in back and turn the sound on?!!!  Too good to be true!  I called the only other Habs fan I know in SF and put out the alert.  Soon we had a great group and although the front bar filled up with rugby shenanigans later on it didn't matter.  I am so happy to know that DCs is an option for hockey!!!!
author: R G.

description:
I came to Danny Coyle's recently for a coworker's birthday party.  There was a group of us there, probably 7-10 people.  A lot of us are bartenders ourselves, including myself.  We were not a rowdy bunch, just looking to have a good time together.  The bar looked great, it had a very comfortable atmosphere to it.  Unfortunately, the woman behind the bar had to ruin our experience.
    When I first arrived, I soon noticed the the bartender had a brash personality, a little 'rough around the edges'.  I watched as she helped the people next to me, and the way she communicated with them seemed to make them a little uncomfortable.  I didn't think much of it, I actually found it a bit entertaining to watch these people squirm as she did her best to give them lousy service.  
     Pretty soon the rest of my party showed up, and we started ordering drinks.  We were all together for no more then 10 minutes when one of my friends tells the bartender a joke that he had been telling the rest of the group.  The joke had a bit of sophomoric humor to it, but nothing overly offensive.  After asking my friend to repeat the joke, the bartender starts ridiculing and snapping him, almost as if he insulted her.  I don't remember it verbatim,  but it was basically "I'm 34 years old, why would you tell me something so stupid", but really laying into him in a very unnecessary way.
     After completely spitting on our good time, the rest of the group tried to collect ourselves from that incredibly awkward and unnecessary encounter. As we started to buy some more drinks.  Another friend of mine called the bartender over to buy the birthday boy a drink.  After ordering the drink, the bartender starts to criticize him for making the birthday boy pay for his own drink, which he clearly did not do.  After trying to explain to her that this wasn't the case (it was loud and it was hard to hear), we made the decision that we needed to leave this place ASAP.
     So we left, and had a great rest of the evening at the bar down the street. 
  So, in conclusion, the bar is pretty, and seems to have a lot of potential.  Unfortunately, even with our best efforts we could not enjoy ourselves, thanks to the unpleasant woman (euphemism) behind the bar.  She told us that she is related to the owner of the bar, which is probably the only reason why she has a job.  This also tells me that she won't be leaving any time soon either!
author: Steven H.

description: Great pub and sports bar. Only got 4 stars bc no food. Great bloody marys as well.
author: Matt M.

description: This bar confuses me.  I heard it used to be the Ah Bodran but now its an Irish bar, a nice Irish bar, a real Irish bar.  I like the Irish, heck I'm half Irish but this place is too nice to be in the lower haight.  I've had issues with my neighborhood gentrifying and unfortunately more places like this equals bad for me.  I do like their open windows, they have plenty of TV's, the bloody mary wasn't bad.  There isn't anything wrong with this place, my hairdresser and her crew hang out there after work but its just another example of the nice moving in, pushing out the old.  I want my old, I don't want trees lining Divis and I'm going to be pissed when the marina darlings move in and push up my rent.  Stay on your fake land down the hill.  Sorry to rant but this is serious, I want to keep the flavor of the lower haight.  Danny Coyle's will probably fit in just fine in a few years after enough wear and tear.  The place seems to be packed regularly and does show football, I mean soccer, still channeling Ireland.   If you live in the neighborhood and want a change from the usual Toronado or Mad Dog it might be worth stopping by.
author: Kristin Marie S.

description: Hard to get a drink in there during today's soccer matches. Props for having the Argentina-Brazil match on today, but why was the English broadcast on over the P.A. speakers while the Spanish was on from the TV speakers -- couldn't hear anything!
author: Adam Z.

description: An irish pub with comfy leather chairs and gorgeous bathrooms?  So maybe it's a little confused but I loved it anyway.  Good beer, great service.  And, once they heard we were with yelp they sent over a free round.  Now that's savvy!
author: Elena S.

description: I don't like it. It's not god-awful, but I can imagine so much better at this particular location. How about a place called "The Wiggle Room" where thirsty cyclists can have a mellow beer and then wobble away? How about some themed place, like Beauty Bar or something, where people actually dance (we need a place for people who like to dance here that's more bar than club--even though I don't dance I am thinking of the common good). How about a place to spotlight all the DJs we have in this area? I'd love to hear what my neighbors are up to with all that fancy gear.  I could come up with a lot of other ideas, but I'm too lazy to run a bar. No character, and, I can't say I love the crowd it attracts.
author: Josh K.

description:
I simply go here because the are VERY friendly, but more importantly, they play the SAN JOSE EARTHQUAKES games.

Go  SJ  EARTHQUAKES  !!!
author: B D.

description: This was a really fun bar that had a bunch of tvs showing the football game. Lots of bears fans in tha house!!! Plus, they have hangar one lime vodka, my fave:) Good casual crowd too.
author: ella a.

description: Solid bar. Great for watching Sunday football, as they usually show all the games on their various TVs. Decent domestic and Irish beer selection. Also a nice place to hang out in the afternoon as they keep the entrance to their bar wide open so you can sit and enjoy a beer, watch a game, and still get some fresh air.
author: Kenny L.

description: No flavor in this joint. Then again, I'm biased because it replaced one of the best bars in Frisco: Don's Different Ducks. With a throwback jukebox  full of James Brown and Aretha, White Mike playing pool in the back, and neighborhood love all the way around, Don's Different Ducks represented the diversity and quirky spirit of the Bay.  Danny Coyle's, unfortunately, just seems like part of the inexplicable wave of Irish pubs popping up in the City.
author: Richard R.

description: This place is like a little sanitized oasis in the middle of the more often grungy Lower Haight and yet it's perfectly at home.  You can tell that the place was recently remodeled.  This place is a decent size for small to medium groups wanting to enjoy some drinks.  It's not so small that you feel crowded and it's not so big as to invite a horde of people.  The service was very good and the prices were right.  They don't give out free attitude with your drinks at this place which is very refreshing.  Some places think that treating people badly is a way of giving themselves some credibility in this city, fortunatly this place has an owner who is taking a different approach and focusing on treating people right.  The only thing I can think of that could use improvement is a better selection on the jukebox.
author: Luis M.

description: This is a pretty classy joint!  ha!  I was expecting more of a dive, but instead got a laidback, loungy w/out being too "Marina", packed place w/ a fun crowd.  Great beers on tap, kickin' '80s tunes, and a bunch of "who gives a shizznet, I'm here to have some fun!" rhythmically-challenged 30-year olds sweating up the dance floor!  It was a blast.
author: Susan L.

description:
how do you ruin a perfect irish pub? spruce it up. 

the same guys that brought you the forgettable martin mack's took an awesome neighborhood irish dive 'an bodhran' (dark wood, cool ceiling, low lighting, musty smell of old beer) and brought in a giant vacuum to suck all the character and charm out it. 

and what do you replace them with...  slate tile? flatscreen tvs? wall sconce lights that fit better in a cheap ski condo? a big obnoxious mirror with a plastic sign? check, check, check, and... check.

an bodhran needed new bathrooms, not a wholesale character rape. bummer to lose a great bar in the hood and be left with... this place??
author: Hunter H.

description: Being born and raised in SF, this was the first time being at this establishment. After ordering 2 rounds of 3 beers (total 6, amongst 3 people), I go up to the bar to close my tab only to find out my card was about to be charged for more than double that amount. After my card was declined due to an excessive charge that I was not prepared for, I asked the bartender what the final amount was. After discussing this with the bartender and owner they had told me an unidentifable man in my party that was no longer at the bar had been charging my account. I explained that there were only two people in the bar that I knew and after the owner walked away to fix the situation, the bar tender proceeded to yell at me because they had to cover the loss cost of someone that supposedly left the bar that I didn't know charging my card. After I told her I was done speaking with her and would only speak the owner she preceded to tell me I owed everyone an apology and went to the owner to throw a tantrum, after i refused to speak with her further. After the owner charged my card the correct amount he decided to change his attitude after he originally apologized for the situation.  If anything I was the one that deserved an apology for the "person no longer with my party" that was unauthorized in charging my card had such a tab. Needless to say, I will never go back due to the disrespectful manner I was approached with. Such a disappointment and a poorly run establishment. Customer service is clearly unheard of here amongst its bar tenders.
author: Bridget W.

description: Came heret on May 15, 2008...heat wave day.  It was hot out.  The inside of this place was even hotter than the outside...that sucked.  then the bartender girl told us she was out of all the things we ordered.  The keg thingy was broken so the draft beers were warm, the selection of bottled beers was not so great...i mean...it was ok here...i guess.
author: desiree n.

description: This is such a friendly neighborhood bar! And it's sooooooo clean-even the bathrooms. It's pretty chill here and I love the ambiance-there's plenty of seating with all the tables and rounds. Tanya is my favorite gal behind the bar-she's so cool and she's so damn fast behind that bar! I like coming here and throwing back some brews-but of course those Tiger Beers ;)
author: Dessa R.

description: I used to come here before it became Danny Coyle's and it is quite different now.  It's sleeker and cleaner than the other dive bars in the area almost to the point of being bland.  It's also brighter with higher ceilings and shiny fancy fixtures.  The crowd is different too.  P and I had fun just observing the younguns in the place.  It was prolly the new freshmen class at USF.  The girls sipped colored frou frou drinks in martini glasses and the boys seemed not to have learned yet to put the coasters on their beers before leaving for a smoke.
author: Pelle Y.

description: With sports on the TV and free wifi there's something for everyone at Danny Coyle's. I spent most of the Champions League finals on my laptop, but it was a lot of fun being surrounded by soccer fans screaming and jumping up and down. The bar has a pretty good selection of beers, and isn't too expensive. It's definitely a nice place to relax and have a few drinks.
author: Will A.

description: Just went for a quick drink on a Monday evening...but...$10 for 3 import beers...in San Francisco? I gasped and thought I got away with getting a free beer.
author: Chris C.

description:
Only been there a few times but always have had fun.  People seem pretty fun and nice  Some of the guys are a bit boarish however...  Bartenders are quite nice and competant.   A bit out of place for the Lower Haight.  
For what it is, however- an Irish pub-  it's too expensive for my sensibilities.
author: Anthony G.

description: Typical bar, but it's got an Irish name and is nicer than most irish pubs. Lots of flat screens and soft colors make the environment inviting. The wide selection of Scotch and Hangar One helps as well...
author: Nicolas H.

description: I'm sorry, but there are too many dive bars in SF. I think it's a disease. Thank god they cleaned this place up. Don't get me wrong, I understand the whole dive bar thing... but too many is not a good thing. An Bodhran was nasty, old, smelly, dark and just tacky. If you want a dive bar, go to the many that are located in the Lower Haight. It's about time that the neighborhood gets at least one place where I'm not worried about the bathrooms. Besides, this place is partially owned by Brian (the best bartender in San Francisco) and that means that it wasn't revamped by someone who doesn't know the place.... it was revamped by a true Irishman who knew what problems An Bodhran had. Congrats Brian!
author: Megan D.

description: I liked it better before the remodel.  It's sooooo loud.  The crowd has changed, too shi-shi for my tastes.  On the plus side, the bartenders are cool.
author: Amanda A.

description: I have no idea what this bar wants to be.  Is it a sports bar?  A lounge bar?  An irish bar?   Whichever way it's nice to have bar options in the neighborhood plus they have a cool jukebox in the shape of a musical note.
author: Dan B.

description: So glad they kept this spot Irish!  Totally revamped... it even still smells new so you better check it out before the bar mold sets in.  Great guys behind the bar who won't let you out of there without them buying you a pint, and there are even Irishmen to chat with who'll be buying you a pint as well!  Nice addition to the hood by day... don't really know who the night will bring in : )
author: Tara G.

description: i love this place....one of my favorite in the city.  the bartenders are wonderful...it's clean, it's open, it's great on a warm afternoon or a cold night.   Oh, and to the person who has yet to encounter a truly disgusting bathroom, just head down the street to the Toronado or over to Fly Bar.   Lord only knows what kind of bacteria is brewing on those floors.
author: chrissy k.

description:
It'll never be a destination for me. Good place to take the parents. Or certain friends. Or in case of an emergency.

It's clean, the bartenders have passable knowledge, and on occassion you may be suprised with some entertainment.

But really, it's not a place for a night out.

Sorry.

My recommendation is that they could cut back on the attitude, as it doesn't belong in the neighborhood.
author: kyoto s.

description: went here lastnight for the first time....it was eehh. coolish crowd that included b2b stragglers and middle aged working class men.  got hit on by a creepy guy in a captain costume, not so fun. plenty of room to sit, music was ok.  enjoyed the dog doorman. all in all ppl were pretty friendly.  maybe im just being pessimistic about this place because i was sober driver....that must be it. oh yeah and they were playing the sharks game, so that was definitely a plus.  might come back, liked the neighborhood.
author: Jamaica B.

description: I have been craving yummy Indian food, So my boyfriend and I decided to walk to get dinner at Indian oven and spend some time talking and "rekindleing" our relationship. On our way , we came up to Danny coyles or as I prefer to call it (Danny's Coyle). We decide to have a beer before dinner.  Cut screen 2 hours later......laughing, drunk, enjoying free shots from the kind bartender.  My boyfriend is Irish so when we go to Irish establishments, his accent gets nice and thick, which helped in the rekindleing, since I love a thick Irish accent!We never made it to dinner but we did in fact rekindle our relationship! Although, I did wake up at 4 a.m starving. But no longer craving Indian food, now a jamba juice. Which I have yet to get either and am instead having a class of wine.  Hmmmmmm, maybe I should be yelping A.A..
author: butters m.

description: I stopped by Danny Coyle's not knowing what to expect as I'm more of a SOMA/Financial District drinker. I was pleasantly surprised. The place was clean with a hip vibe. I liked the fact that it had cool mood lighting and a very EURO feel. I'll be back again and again.
author: D Scott D.

description:
You know that "humph" sound you make (or at least I make) when you are confronted by something pleasantly surprising.  Like "humph, that romantic comedy/weird foreign film/horror movie was actually pretty good."  Well, when I walked into Danny Coyle's I thought "humph, this places looks pretty nice."  Shiny bar, glowing green thingies, plasmas - the whole places has this upscale Irish bar thing going for it that's unexpected in the lovably scumy lower haight.  I really wanted to like this place.

Unfortunately, a lack of security quickly put a damper on my opinion of Danny Coyle's.  Now, don't get me wrong, I understand that a-holes can wander into any bar and ruin an evening.  But when (1) you're serving vast amounts of liquor, (2) in the Haight, (3) on a Friday night  and there's a total lack of any sort of bouncer you deserve to be put on blast.  The script:

Act 1
Scene 1
J, N, C and P walk into bar
J: "humph, this places looks pretty nice."  
N goes to bar and gets drinks.  J, C, and P go sit at the only available table.  N returns with drinks.
N: blah, blah, blah, game, blah, giants
C: blah, blah, girl stuff, blah blah
RANDOM GUY THAT IS SO DRUNK HE'S SLURRING HIS WORDS BEYOND RECOGNITION AND HAVING TROUBLE MAINTAINING HIS BALANCE (henceforth "RGTISDHSHWBRAHTMHB"): hey man high flive!
J: uhh
RGTISDHSHWBRAHTMHB continues wobbling with hand in air.  J awkwardly gives him a high five.
RGTISDHSHWBRAHTMHB (to C): high flive!
C, weirded out, reluctantly gives RGTISDHSHWBRAHTMHB a high five.
RGTISDHSHWBRAHTMHB (to P): high flive!
P capitulates.  RGTISDHSHWBRAHTMHB wanders away.
C: What the hell was that?
J: Drunk people, whatever.
RGTISDHSHWBRAHTMHB returns.
RGTISDHSHWBRAHTMHB: high five.
J: that's ok man
RGTISDHSHWBRAHTMHB: come on, blah, blah, drunk talk, blah blah
J: Hey, I think there's some people over there that want a high five
RGTISDHSHWBRAHTMHB: hey mlam you're just trying to get rid of me.  not cool mlam.
J smiles.
RGTISDHSHWBRAHTMHB: ok mlam. ok.
RGTISDHSHWBRAHTMHB makes a fist to get a pound.  J gives him a pound.  RGTISDHSHWBRAHTMHB  walks away.  
J: they need to get that guy out of here
C: there's no bouncer
J: damn
RGTISDHSHWBRAHTMHB returns.
RGTISDHSHWBRAHTMHB : high five!
(repeat 3,471,023,841,208,321 f-ing times, each time with RGTISDHSHWBRAHTMHB being more obnoxious and exhibiting less equilibrium)
J, N, C & P finish drinks and vacate in a sour mood.
End Scene.
author: Jason S.

description: Met some of my Irish friends for drinks on a Friday!  I would never have known about this place had it not been for my Gaelic connection.  The owner, Brian, used to bartend at Martin Macks down the street and ventured out on his own!  So cool...anyways the service was fast and furious and the concoctions well above par!  The music was entertaining and not too loud and the crowd was a great melange of characters!!!  Definitely a good time for you peeps on stag or coupled up!  Slainte!
author: Cherry M.

description: What happened to An Bodhran?  They cleaned it up, added some lights, added a bunch of tvs, added some speakers, raised the prices, and ... wait, what happened to An Bodhran?
author: Tim G.

description: This place is great.  I went there with two friends to watch the FA Cup final after spending a miserable 45 minutes down the street at Mad Dog.  Even though Danny Coyle's is half the size it was not nearly as crowded.  The six plasmas make it so there's a good tv in every direction and getting a drink was easy (Guinness on tap).  The best part is that this pub is clean and the bathrooms are immaculate!   The staff was friendly as well.  This is definitely the new spot to watch footie on a Saturday or Sunday morning.
author: Marco C.

description: This is the best place in town.  For all those haters out there who do not think it is an authentic Irish pub then maybe you should meet the owner and all the bartenders (save one...it's okay Daniel).  This place is the biz and they let me bring my pups in whenever I feel like it...as long as they don't do their biz on the floor and bark all evening it is all good.  Saturday and Sunday are sports days, soccer in the morning and then football all day long.  They even have NFL Sunday ticket and the try to accommodate all football lovers!  The weekend evenings are hoppin' and the crowd is great.  Get over yourselves and get into the best bar on the Lower Haight!
author: Ashley E.

description: I love this place!! It's nice, it's clean and it wasn't crowded on a Thursday night. Also they have a men's room, a woman's room and a man and woman's room! How thoughtful!
author: Cathy T.

description: Don's Different Ducks has changed into an Irish sports bar
author: Thomas S.

description: Lacking in personality, at least it's clean.  There are bistro tables and a bar, so there is plenty of room to have a conversation.  Nothing really stands out about this bar besides how consistently young the crowd is.
author: regina k.

description: this bar seems really out of place. if you could pick this up and move it to, oh say, the marina, then things might make a little more sense. it was weird to be in a bar with both d-bags sporting armani exchange and girls with tattoo sleeves. very weird. as far as irish pubs go, this one is really nice, and if i cared about sports, i might think of frequenting it more. drinks are overpriced for the location and i thought the cute bartender was checking me out but he was just telling his coworker to ID me. jerk.
author: Rachael S.

description: My new neighborhood Irish Pub.  This place is HUGE  and has an absolutely beautiful wood bar.  Great bartenders--they're glad to hear you're ok the day after your birthday when you were a stumbling mess.  And they took good care of my purse until I could get back over there to retrieve it.
author: Nicole H.

description: Great place for a beer. Very friendly staff.  Although I liked the dark old bar I have grown to love Sunday's at Dannys.  The regulars at the back of the bar are friendly and welcoming. They have 5 TV's with the Sunday ticket and most Sunday's people bring food in to share wth everyone. Overall it's a good neighborhood bar I dont' know how it stacks up late night. In my opinion if  you want to watch a game and drink a beer with friendly locals it's perfect.
author: Brian B.

description: I don't drink much, and I am pretty over bars. That being said, I am a huge UFC fan. I went to Danny Coyle's to watch the fights tonight, and what a great place. People were friendly. It was not a big pick up scene, though it did have a pretty descent representation of young good looking singles. I found the staff to be attentive and friendly. The bar was not overcrowded, and when it did get full, it was still comfortable. I could watch the fights from any place in the bar, and though I was happy to stand, I found a seat without much of a problem. THere were no drunks in the place, and a live DJ began as the fights ended. Great spot-I will be back.
author: J C.

description: I love this bar! Every time I go here I have a blast! They have a nice selection of alcohol and beer. Always I fun friendly group around.
author: Bryan M.

description: Quiz night is great, but a haughty overcharging bartender I do hate. Still, I'd go back to test my trivia and watch some sports on the big screen.
author: Bee H.

description: I fucking love this place.  I went there with a bunch of friends for one of the most absurd nights of my adult life.  The drinks are strong, they have Fernet (which my roommate promptly threw up after each shot) and the music is danceable.  I ran into a bunch of people dressed like Nacho Libre while outside for a smoke.  They gave me a HUGE Nacho Libre keychain that recites quotes from the movie.  Sick.  Then we ran into this El Salvadoran guy who let me listen to Mana on his mp3 player.  Then he gave my friend Zach a mini-flashlight and told him could put his cock in it.  Seriously.  Zach ended up giving this guy his phone number.  Guess who called Zach on New Year's Eve?  Cock-in-a-flashlight guy.
author: Sarah H.

description: I've only been to Danny Coyle's after work during the week.  There is a good crowd at that time.  They have a good beer selection and a friendly bartender.  I also like that it is so clean.
author: Sara H.

description:
Hey, Trivia night on Wednesdays is at 7:30... Photo gallery and bonus question here:

http://www.brainstormer.com/venueDisplay.aspx?venueID=171&state=ca
author: Bob N.

description: Great bar, super friendly owner and staff.  It's definitely a place that appreciates your business.  Cleaner and more stylish than any other bar in the neighborhood with a nice selection of liquor and beer.  Girls, it's worth stopping in for a drink just to use a bathroom without urine or puke all over the floor!
author: D'Arcy C.

description: I love this bar. This is my home bar. The night I moved to SF in August, my friend and I stumbled upon this bar. We needed a drink after the 14 hour (straight) drive from Seattle! Tonya was our bartender, and she STILL remembers me every time I go in to have a drink! Friendly staff  and great drinks, not to mention clean and usually a diverse crowd of twenty-somethings to the older crowd, I always feel welcome in this bar.
author: Caitlin M.

description:
bar trolling with the wife over labor day in the haight. stepped in here after having been to Molotov's. yeah i know. i didn't fit in there either. 

i give it a three cause i have been to better and i have been to worse. been drunk all over this land from maine to the rio grande. toasted in hickok's in deadwood, blasted in mandalay bay, vegas and paid $12 a shot for blue berry infused grappa in bar 888 at the intercontinental. ain't choosy. like the fact that the place was clean, even the shitters. drinks were reasonable. the only thing i didn't like was when i ordered a b&b with a coffee chaser, the bartender asked me if that meant a cup of coffee. come on. b&b is benedictine and brandy. she grabbed a bottle of benedictine and i had to tell her to add some brandy to it. way to god dam sweet if you dint. the red wax seal is benedictine and the gold seal is the premixed. i would have been pissed but it was only five bucks. plenty of sports on so i might go back.
author: scott c.

description: I live in the neighborhood. This place is very cool looking with all friendly bartenders. Safe enough to go to have a few drinks and walk home. I love it.
author: Puangrak A.

description: I love this bar, the staff is always friendly, they are always open for the big games.  After only going there a handful of times to watch soccer in the mornings they knew me by name and drink.
author: Thomas H.

description: for the bartender knowing to top off a pint of guinness with a shamrock float.
author: Pickle R.

description: Danny Coyle's rocks.  5 stars for super-fast service from seasoned staff, 2 women' s bathrooms, and because every time we stop in for one we stay for several because we have such a good time.  This place just has a great ambiance for chilling out with a good drink.  I love how the windows are wide open on nice days, and that I never know what I am going to get in terms of the crowd (people watching).  Plus I see nothing wrong with a bar that is actually clean and does not have all-black painted walls and ceilings (and I am not a marina bar fan. People come with friends and mind their business, who cares what you wear.)  I know if I tell someone to meet me here, they will have a good time, too.  And maybe a new hang-out.
author: Kim S.

description: This bar has a broad beer list, good atmosphere and excellent for watching UFC fights ($15 p.p.). Not too crowded, good price and nice staff.
author: kris k.

description: this is a good spot.  i didn't get there when it was an bodhran (sorry).  therefore, i'm probably the only person on here that is scoring this place based solely on how it is now.  simply put, it feels a bit out of place for lower haight.  it's either pleasantly clean or excessively sterile, depending on your world view.  likewise, the beer/drinks are either high quality or too marina.  the patrons are either freshly showered or sadly yuppified.  hey - i report, you decide.  that said, i was ripped while there.
author: schnarf-a-larf a.

description: Any and all fears of Au Bodhran's complete and total demise have now been fully realized. Danny Coyle's represents the opposite of it's predecessor. In a very bad way. Gone is the intricate Celtic ceiling. It can be assumed that the groovy Lower Haight street scene mural that once hung above Au Bodhran's cozy confines has been trashed. Worse than the erasure of one of the neighborhood's most comfortable Irish pubs is the faux-nice interior that the Martin Mack's owner pulled the trigger on. It makes his Upper Haight bland-o-rama look like the Taj Mahal. Instead of the Guiness-perfect lighting and old-world accents that used to don the walls, the new proprieter went with slate-grey walls, yellow freshman year hanging lamps and chunky pretend-stone tiles. Simply put, this place has been ruined. As my good friend said as I entered the strip-mall looking watering whole, incredulous look plastered on my face, "welcome to SFO." To send us on our way, the tastemaker DJ behind the bar played us out to the Hootie And The Blowfish classic, "Hold My Hand." Perfect.
author: Ben H.

description: The bartender was a man this time.  He was nice.  He served me a cider and had an honest looking mien.  The man on the other side of the bar was not a gentleman.  He bought my friend and me a shot of Bailey's, of which I could only do half, and then sucked my face. My friend meanwhile, had gone over to the other corner of the bar and was making fast friends with the owner, who then gave us another irish cream to toss back. How could we say no? I think the DJ they hired was on drugs. Watchout, this place is W.I.L.D.
author: Reena R.

description: Great little Irish bar in the lower Haight. Everyone there was extraordinarily friendly (read drunk) in the middle of the afternoon. The owner went out of his way and offered all of the yelper's present a shot or a drink of their choice. The only other time that has happened to me was when a group of us went drinking after an all you can drink beer Mexican brunch in San Diego at 10 a.m. What do you do after drinking more beer than the owners ever expected? Go across the street to an Irish bar and have some doughnuts with your free whiskey. Back to the review, this bar is really upscale and has some top shelf vodkas like Hanger One and Charbay among others. Flat screens showing Giants baseball on some and 49ers pre-season games on others. Awesome happy hour specials $4 pints of Guinness and $6 margaritas or pomegranate margaritas. They also allow food from a number of the joints on Haight.
author: Rob H.

description: OK, I too, am waiting for the decor and the atmosphere to shape up a bit.       But let's focus on the fact that the place has amazing potential: the coolest and most sincere barman around, Brian Coyle, has opened his own place. That in itself makes it worth sticking around to see how the place shapes up.  There are plenty of stinky dirty bars with graffiti infused bathrooms in other parts of the Haight - do we really need to mourn the loss of An Bodhran?  Right now it's a clean slate waiting to develop its own character and personality. Congrats to Brian!
author: Jennifer A.

description: Danny Coyle's is a lovely Irish bar. It is aesthetically pleasing, the bar tenders are all fairly attentive, they serve Harp on tap, and the e-Juke Box has just about everything under the sun if you are willing to drop a few coins. It is definitely not the cheapest bar in the hood, but for the lower haight they have a fantastic selection of whiskey, vodka and tequila. They even satiated my parent's very astute taste in delicious anejos... that is unusual for an Irish bar. They regularly have the sports of the moment on the TVs that are spread throughout, and they have an entertaining trivia night on Wednesdays. I love this block (Haight btwn Steiner and Pierce) with the great Irish Bar, Baghdad Nights (Iraqi Cuisine $$), Axum (Ethiopian Cuisine $), Katz Bagels ($), a few boutique shops and Sunrise Liquor (Solomon is the best). I write about this block in hopes that I can help pick up business just two blocks from the Lower Haight hub. We need to support these fantastic establishments to ensure diversity in the neighborhood and to support our local small businesses.
author: Jenifer G.
